title: Cow
content: Cow Normal Lunar New Year Old Model Behavior Passive Location Player's Island  A cow is a large passive mob that was added in the October 3, 2020 update and a source of milk .  It is the first animal passive mob in Islands .  Spawning [ ]  The number of cows that can exist on the player's island varies depending on their level in Animal Care .  Player's island [ ]  A cow spawns on the player's island when it first generates.  Cow spawn egg [ ]  Cows can be spawned with cow spawn eggs . Cow spawn eggs are obtained by breeding cows or purchasing them from Taliyah .  Behavior [ ]  A cow can be lured with wheat and can sleep on hay beds . During the Christmas 2021 event, feeding, petting, or milking a cow had a 0.1% chance of rewarding a cow ornament .  Milking [ ]  A cow can be milked using a bucket , creating a milk bucket . Cows can be milked after fully feeding them.  Prior to January 22, 2021 , cows can produce milk buckets without being full even while asleep, due to them being unbalanced.  Breeding [ ]  After two cows have been given a potion of fertility each, they will breed, creating a cow spawn egg . The egg will be of a tier between 1 and 3.  Sleeping [ ]  When it becomes night in-game, cows will go to sleep. While they can sleep anywhere and sometimes will, they prefer to sleep on a hay bed.  Inspecting [ ]  Cows can be inspected to show a menu that allows the player to see information about the cow, listed below:  Mount Sell value Information Food level Favorite foods Happiness level Traits (fertility, productivity, and friendliness) Personality  Feeding [ ]  Cows can be fed approximately every 90 - 100 seconds. Cows eat wheat , but will also each have its own favorite foods. The foods a cow can have as its favorite food are berry pie , honey toast , bread , and tomato soup .  Feeding a cow will increase its food and friendliness level. The food level is necessary to keep above 20% or the cow will start losing happiness. The milking cooldown can also be skipped if a cow is fed.  A wooden trough , metal trough , or automated trough can be used to feed cows.  Like other animals , it will eat from a grass block if no troughs are nearby, but doing so will not replenish its hunger meter nor give Animal Care XP.  Petting [ ]  A cow can be pet every 5 minutes which increases their happiness level. The action yields 6 Animal Care XP (24 XP with the 4x daily bonus).  Mounting [ ]  Cows can be mounted via the button in the inspect menu if the player is level 8 or higher in Animal Care . A mounted cow can be rode anywhere within the server. If the cow is dismounted outside the player's island, or falls into the void, the cow will respawn on the island spawn point. Mounting a cow does not grant any speed boost or jump boost.  Personality [ ]  Cows are assigned a personality upon spawning. All personalities have the same possibility, except for resourceful which is more uncommon.  Personality Description Effects Trivia Lazy "Your cow is lazy. They sleep for a long time, but gain a bit of happiness while sleeping." Cow will sleep during the afternoon and evening, but will still gain happiness while sleeping. Before the January 22, 2021 update, all cows had the equivalent of this trait. Level-headed "Your cow is level-headed. They will not gain or lose happiness quickly." Self-explanatory Loyal "Your cow is loyal. They are extra happy around players and animals but can become very lonely when left alone." Cow will gain happiness faster if players and/or animals are within an unknown number blocks, but will lose happiness fast if they are further than that threshold. Friendly "Your cow is friendly. They will bring you extra gifts." Cow will bring you extra gifts Resourceful "Woah! Your cow is resourceful. They will produce items faster than other animals." Cow will make products (milk) faster than normal. This is the rarest personality.  Skins [ ]  The cow has one animal skin , Lunar New Year. The skin was purchasable for 499 Robux before going off-sale on February 19, 2021 .  Each copy of a skin can only be equipped to one cow.  History [ ]  October 3, 2020 Added cows. October 6, 2020 Players who don't have a cow will now receive one when they join. Cows will no longer try to eat from a wheat trough while asleep. January 16, 2021 Changed the cow's idle animation. The cow's tail now wags faster when idle. January 22, 2021 Updated the model and animations of cows. Cows can now be spawned with cow spawn eggs . Cows are now able to eat grass blocks if no troughs are nearby. Added traits and personalities and an option to sell cows for coins. Added baby cows. Changed the cow's walking or jumping animation. Fixed the cow's animations failing to load. Removed the cow's mooing animation. Removed the cow's hitboxes. January 25, 2021 Cows fall asleep much later in the day. Cows can no longer be fed while asleep. February 12, 2021 Added the lunar new year cow skin. February 19, 2021 The lunar new year cow skin is made unobtainable. Cows can now be mounted. February 26, 2021 Changed the cow's favorite foods from carrots , potatoes , oranges , lemons , and apples to berry pie , honey toast , bread , and tomato soup . December 18, 2021 Feeding, petting, or milking a cow now has a 0.1% chance of rewarding a cow ornament . January 15, 2022 Feeding, petting, or milking a cow can no longer reward a cow ornament.  Trivia [ ]  Although cows can jump over 3 height blocks, cows cannot jump over blocks with around half-block height, such as slabs . When mounted by a player, the cow can jump higher while sprinting. Cows can escape a box that is supposed to be inescapable by walking through blocks while the player's island is loading. This also goes with most animals. Cows can sit on furniture blocks . Cows will be stuck once sitting on a furniture block. When the seat is broken by the player, the cow cannot move until the player reloads the game or mounts the cow. Cows are the first animal passive mob in Islands . Like all other animals, cows may eat from a grass block instead of from troughs, but doing so will not replenish their hunger meter nor give Animal Care XP. This ability was added in the January 22, 2021 update. Cows use the same eating animation as sheep , pigs , and yaks . This was likely can be done if no troughs are nearby. The eating sound of cows is reduced when eating grass blocks. Prior to January 22, 2021, cows had 1 hitbox and 3 hitboxes while asleep. Since then, cows can only come into contact with other cows. Cows are likely gender-neutral as they have features of both genders — they have horns of a bull but a large udder with of a cow. Prior to January 22, 2021, cows were 2 blocks tall but were changed to be 1.5 blocks tall later in that update. The old model of cows had a large udder with 6 teats, contrary to the 4 teats of real-life cows. However, the current model of cows have a small udder but doesn't have teats. Prior to January 22, 2021 , a cow stuck in the walking animation while idle, similar to lagging. Prior to January 22, 2021, cows could get stuck in the walking animation while idle or asleep. Cows are able to move with the sleeping animation, but this can be fixed by mounting and dismounting them. Prior to January 22, 2021, cows can produce milk without being full even while asleep, due to them being unbalanced. Prior to January 22, 2021, cows do not have a looking animation, similar to turkeys , horses , and vultures . The old model of cows is the second-tallest animal model in Islands , with the tallest being horses. Prior to January 22, 2021, a cow always opened its eyes, even while asleep. Cows share many things with other animals . Cows share the same eating sound as sheep, pigs, turkeys, yaks, and horses. Cows have the same eye model as sheep, pigs, chickens , frogs , and rabbits . The old model of cows had the same eye model as turkeys, ducks , yaks, and horses. Cows have the same animations as sheep, pigs, and yaks. Cows have the same horn model as yaks. Cows have the same favorite foods and award the same amount of XP as turkeys and yaks. The hitbox of players is slightly increased when mounting a cow. Prior to January 22, 2021, players could only have one cow on their island through normal gameplay. A cow mooing prior to January 22, 2021. Prior to January 22, 2021, cows had a mooing animation. Since the January 22, 2021 update, the mooing animation of cows was removed in Islands . Prior to January 22, 2021, cows had a different model, appearance, and animations. Cows, turkeys, and yaks have the same amount of Animal Care XP and number of favorite foods.

title: Cow_Spawn_Egg
content: Cow Spawn Egg Buy cost (Tier 1) 3500 coins Required skill Level 2 Animal Care (To buy Tier 1) Description Spawn a cow with tier 1/2/3 trait maximums. Eats wheat. A cow spawn egg is a spawn egg used to spawn Cows on player islands . It exists in at least 3 tiers, with the first one (tier 1) is purchasable from Taliyah after a player reaches Level 2 Animal Care . The player cannot spawn more than the limit on their island. The limit can be increased by leveling up the Animal Care skill. Tier 2 and 3 spawn eggs can be obtained by breeding 2 Cows , by feeding them both a Potion of Fertility during the day.  Obtaining [ ]  Tier 1 [ ]  Tier 1 cow spawn eggs can be bought from Taliyah for 3,500 coins , after a player reaches Level 2 in the Animal Care skill.  Tier 2 and 3 [ ]  Tier 2 and 3 cow spawn eggs are obtained by breeding 2 cows by feeding each of them a potion of fertility during the day. The cows' stats will determine the tier of the egg dropped.  Usage [ ]  Spawning [ ]  To spawn a baby cow, click/tap anywhere while holding a Cow Spawn Egg. You must have a big enough Max Large Animal Island Bonus, which can be increased by reaching certain levels in the Animal Care skill.  History [ ]  January 22, 2021 Added cow spawn eggs.  Trivia [ ]  When cows were first added to the game, they didn't have spawn eggs and every player automatically got one cow on their island instead. This is the cheapest spawn egg that can be bought from Taliyah .

title: Crab_Pet_Spawn_Egg
content: Crab Pet Spawn Egg The crab pet spawn egg is a spawn egg used to spawn a pet crab . It cannot be dropped, traded , or put in vending machines and chests .  Obtaining [ ]  Treasure chests [ ]  Opening a treasure chest has a 0.25% chance of rewarding a crab pet spawn egg, having a rarity of 'mythic'.  Usage [ ]  Spawning [ ]  To spawn a crab , the player must be the owner of the island they are currently on. While holding the egg, clicking or tapping anywhere on their screen will spawn a crab. title: Crop
content: Crops are plants grown from seeds or saplings that, when fully grown, can either be harvested or produce their respective fruit. There are five types of crops: Ground, Bush, Vine, Tree (Fruits), and Wetland. Each can be planted on grass , farmland , trellises , pond planters , or sand .  Most crops can be sold to Cletus for coins , sold in bulk to Dom , or crafted into other food items. Harvesting crops will give a varying number of Farming XP and a 0.02% chance of a Cletus ornament during the Christmas 2021 event.  Crop types [ ]  Bush crops [ ]  Bush crops can only be planted on grass and the bush itself is not collected upon harvesting. Harvesting a bush crop will drop some of its berries and, very rarely, a seed. The exact number of berries rewarded is scaled with the player's Farming level and is boosted for owners of the VIP gamepass .  The bushes can be watered but not fertilized, but watering one does not quicken its growth time. There are currently 4 bush crops, 2 of which are seasonal .  Ground crops [ ]  Ground crops are crops whose seed can either be planted on sand or farmland , but never grass . Harvesting a ground crop may reward the player 1 - 2 of the crop's seed along with the crop itself; the number of crops given is dependent on the crop type, the player's Farming level, and is boosted for owners of the VIP gamepass .  All ground crops have a respective crop totem except for cacti , chili peppers , spirit crops , and void parasites . Ground crops that can be planted on farmland can also be watered or fertilized to quicken their growth time. There are currently 15 ground crops, 14 that are planted on farmland, 4 of which are seasonal ; and 1 that is planted on sand.  Oily crops [ ]  When some ground crops are harvested by a totem and outputted onto a conveyor belt , they become oily. Oily crops can only be sold to the oily crops villager through the industrial merchant teleseller or washed in a washing station or industrial washing station to become their non-oily counterpart. There are currently 6 types of oily crops. (Oily Starfruit and Oily Pineapple are not obtained by having a totem output them onto a conveyor)  Vine crops [ ]  Vine crops can only be planted in trellises and cannot be fertilized. Harvesting a vine crop will reward the player the crop's seed along with the crop itself; the number of crops given is scaled to the player's Farming level and is boosted for owners of the VIP gamepass . There are currently 3 vine crops.  Wetland crops [ ]  Wetland crops can only be planted in pond planters . There are currently 2 wetland crops.  Tree crops [ ]  Tree crops, or fruits , are harvested from their respective fruit tree . All tree saplings can be planted on grass, but palm trees can also be planted on sand. Harvesting a fruit from its tree will always give one fruit and a 4% chance of dropping its respective sapling too. There are currently 7 types of tree crops.  Selling [ ]  Most harvested crops can be sold to Cletus , but the seasonal ones can only be sold to him on player islands during certain seasons . Crops can be packed into crates and large crates and sold to Dom for a higher value. Oily crops can only be sold to the oily crops villager through the industrial merchant teleseller . The sell prices of certain crops change for every update, but the sell prices will be reverted back to its original amount on the next update. There is currently an unpatched bug in game where if a player leaves then rejoins on their island, all planted crops will be instantly grown. Chili peppers and seaweed are the only crops that cannot be sold. Pineapples are the highest-selling crop. Plums are the highest-selling non-seasonal crop. Before the January 15, 2022 , players were still able to obtain extra candy cane seeds when harvesting candy canes. Pumpkins , watermelons , radishes , blackberries , coconuts , kiwis and Plum are the only crops that cannot be used to craft other food items. Raspberries are the only crop that cannot be harvested by players. Turkeys cannot reward extra berry seeds when harvesting berry bushes . Prior to the June 3, 2022 update, Cletus could not buy crops from the player in the Hub ; instead, the shop belonged to Tom . During the Halloween 2022 event, Tom replaced Cletus due to Cletus being zombified.

content: Crystal may refer to:  Amethyst Crystal Buffalkor Crystal Emerald Crystal Crystallized Aquamarine Crystallized Gold Crystallized Iron Crystallized Obsidian Crystalline

title: Crystalline
content: Crystalline Seed cost 3,500 coins Planted on Farmland Sell price 35 coins Edible A crystalline is a crop that grows on farmland from crystalline ivy seeds .  It has various uses, some of them are listed below!  Obtaining [ ]  Harvesting [ ]  Harvesting a crystalline ivy yields 1 - 3 crystalline, 1 crystal line ivy seed , and 12 Farming XP (48 XP with the 4x daily bonus).  Growth [ ]  The growth time of crystallines can be shortened by 20% when watered with a watering can or basic sprinkler , or fertilized with basic fertilizer . If watered and fertilized, the growth time will be shortened by 30%. content: Crystalline Plow Type Farming Tool Recipe 30 Steel Plate 3 Crystalline 20 Pine Wood Crafted with Workbench Tier 4  A crystalline plow is a tool that is used to turn grass into farmland in a 5x1 grid, and vice versa. Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Crystalline Plow 3 Crystalline 30 Steel Plate 20 Pine Wood Workbench Tier 4 None  Usage [ ]  Plowing [ ]  The crystalline plow is used to till grass into farmland that most crops can be planted on. To use the crystalline plow, click on the blocks of grass and they will turn into farmland in a 5x1 grid. It can can also turn farmland back into grass. title: Crystallized_Aquamarine
content: Crystallized Aquamarine Description Rare drop from Aquamarine Rocks. Crystallized aquamarine is a crystal that has a chance of dropping when mining aquamarine rocks and fishing .  Obtaining [ ]  Mining [ ]  Crystallized aquamarine has a 0.5% of dropping when breaking aquamarine rocks . It can only be obtained by fully breaking an aquamarine rock, and can never be obtained by breaking it to its halfway point. Aquamarine totems cannot output crystallized aquamarine onto conveyor belts .  Fishing [ ]  Crystallized aquamarine can be obtained by fishing as a treasure item, having a rarity of 'rare'.  Usage [ ]  Crafting ingredient [ ]  Image Name Recipe Crafting station Aquamarine Sword 200 Aquamarine Shard 2 Crystallized Aquamarine Anvil Small Fish Tank 5 Glass 15 Oak Wood 2 Crystallized Aquamarine Furniture Workbench Blueprint required Tidal Spellbook 1 Spellbook 2 Crystallized Aquamarine Anvil  History [ ]  July 25, 2020 Added crystallized aquamarine. September 18, 2020 Crystallized aquamarine can now be used to craft small fish tanks . May 13, 2022 Crystallized aquamarine can now be used to craft aquamarine swords .

title: Crystallized_Gold
content: Crystallized Gold Description Rare drop from Gold Nodes. Crystallized gold is a crystal that has a 10% chance of dropping when fully mining gold rocks .  Obtaining [ ]  Mining [ ]  Crystallized gold has a 10% chance of dropping when breaking gold rocks . It can only be obtained by breaking a gold rock fully; breaking it to its halfway point cannot yield crystallized gold.  Usage [ ]  Crafting ingredient [ ]  Image Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Food Processor 2 Crystallized Gold 5 Green Sticky Gear 2 Steel Rod Workbench Tier 2 Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Level 25 Forging  History [ ]  June 26, 2020 Added crystallized gold. September 18, 2020 Crystallized gold can no longer be used to craft food processors . October 3, 2020 Increased the drop rate of crystallized gold from 2% to 10%. Crystallized gold can now be used to craft food processors again.  Trivia [ ]  Crystallized gold used to have a drop rate of 2% — equivalent to the old drop rate of crystallized iron ; however, it had its drop rate buffed to 10% on October 3, 2020 in order to make it easier to obtain due to gold rocks being rarer. Crystallized gold has the same model as crystallized iron, crystallized aquamarine , crystallized obsidian , buffalkor crystals , and amethyst crystals , with the only difference among them being color and transparency. When the September 18, 2020 update was released, crystallized gold could no longer be used to craft the food processor and therefore had no use. This recipe of the food processor was later changed on October 3, 2020 and now requires 2 crystallized gold to craft instead of the initial 3.

title: Crystallized_Iron
content: Crystallized Iron Description Rare drop from mining iron rocks. Crystallized iron is a crystal that has a chance of dropping when mining iron rocks .  Obtaining [ ]  Mining [ ]  Crystallized iron has a 1.5% chance of dropping when breaking iron rocks, both naturally-spawning ones and totem -spawning ones as well. It can only be obtained by breaking an iron rock fully, and can never be obtained by breaking it to its halfway point. Iron and test totems will not output crystallized iron onto conveyor belts .  Usage [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Image Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Vending Machine 1 Crystallized Iron 5 Green Sticky Gear 10 Gold Ingot Workbench Tier 2 Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Level 55 Economy Basic Sprinkler 1 Crystallized Iron 2 Green Sticky Gear 30 Iron Ingot Workbench Tier 2 Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 None Washing Station 1 Crystallized Iron 100 Maple Wood 30 Iron Ingot Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 None Randomizer 1 Crystallized Iron 4 Steel Rod 5 Iron Ingot Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 None Merger 1 Crystallized Iron 4 Steel Rod 5 Iron Ingot Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 None Filter Conveyor 3 Crystallized Iron 12 Steel Rod 40 Iron Ingot Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 None Drill 1 Crystallized Iron 1 Blue Sticky Gear 8 Steel Rods Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Level 18 Forging Iron War Axe 3 Crystallized Iron 1 Steel Rod 40 Iron Ingot Anvil Level 12 Combat Split Conveyor 1 Crystallized Iron 4 Steel Rod 20 Electrite Electrical Workbench (Level 1) None Metal Trough 1 Crystallized Iron 40 Iron Ingot Animal Bench Level 26 Animal Care  Trivia [ ]  The drop rate for crystallized iron has been changed multiple times since it was added to the game. On September 18, 2020 it was increased, likely due to the addition of drills , which required crystallized iron in its recipe. The limit for crystallized iron is 5,000. Joining a new server with an amount more than the limit in the inventory or hotbar will reset it back to 5,000. Utilizing chests or vending machines can allow one to bypass the limit.

title: Crystallized_Obsidian
content: Crystallized Obsidian Dropped by Bandit Description Used to craft Obsidian Weaponry on the anvil Crystallized obsidian is the crystallized version of obsidian .  Obtaining [ ]  Mining [ ]  Crystallized obsidian has a 1.5% chance of dropping when breaking a obsidian rock . It can only drop by fully breaking an obsidian rock, and can never be dropped by breaking it to its halfway point.  Mob drop [ ]  Bandits have a 1% of dropping a crystallized obsidian upon defeat.  Purchasing [ ]  Crystallized obsidian can be bought from Evans for 10 doubloons .  Treasure chest [ ]  Opening a treasure chest has a 10% chance of rewarding crystallized obsidian, having a rarity of 'uncommon.'  Usage [ ]  Crafting ingredient [ ]  Image Name Recipe Crafting station Obsidian Greatsword 1 Obsidian Hilt 6 Crystallized Obsidian Anvil Respawn Block 10 Magma Block 5 Crystallized Obsidian 20 Obsidian Workbench Tier 2 Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4  History [ ]  July 17, 2021 Added crystallized obsidian. July 2, 2022 Crystallized obsidian can now be used to craft void blocks .  Trivia [ ]  Crystallized obsidian is misspelled in-game as "Crystalized Obsidian." This is the only type of crystallized ore that can be purchased from a villager .

title: Cuppa_Tea
content: Cuppa Tea Cuppa tea is a developer-only item .  Obtaining [ ]  A cuppa tea cannot be obtained. Only users with access to administrator commands can get this item.  Usage [ ]  Cuppa tea cannot be consumed, has no functionality, and is likely a joke item.  History [ ]  [ Around October 12, 2022 ] Added cuppa tea.

title: Cup_Gnome

Obtaining [ ]  Purchasing [ ]  All three cup gnome variants can be purchased from Eddie for 25 snowflake tickets each. title: Cursed_Grimoire
content: Cursed Grimoire Type Magic weapon Magical class Ethereal Magic weapon type Spellbook Attack damage 50-54 Dropped by Cauldron (2023) The Cursed Grimoire is a weapon in the ethereal class. It was only avaliable in the Halloween Event 2023  Obtaining [ ]  Cauldrons [ ]  Opening a Cauldron (2023) has about a 1% chance of rewarding a Cursed Grimoire, having a rarity of "Mythic". Since the event ended, the only way to obtain the cauldrons is through trade or buying, or you can also do trade to get the grimoire directly.  Attacking [ ]  At level 1 Magic , a Grimoire deals a base damage of 50 HP with a cooldown of 1 second. Its damage can be increased by leveling up the Magic level. There are 2 attacks of Grimoire. It can either fire a Black or a Purple bullet. This weapon can heal you, like the Cursed Hammer .  History [ ]  October 13, 2023 Added the Cursed Grimoire. November 3, 2023 Made the Cursed Grimoire unobtainable.

title: Cursed_Hammer
content: Cursed Hammer Type Heavy Melee Physical class Striking Magic weapon type Ethereal Attack damage 60 HP (Base) 90 HP (Critical) Dropped by Cauldron Description Magical hammer said to hold ethereal energy The cursed hammer is a heavy melee weapon in the striking and ethereal classes.  Obtaining [ ]  2023 Cauldron [ ]  Opening a Cauldron from the Halloween 2023 event has about a 1.25% chance of rewarding the Cursed Hammer, having a rarity of "Mythical.". Since the Halloween Event 2023 ended, the only way to obtain it is by trading for the hammer or trading to get cauldrons to open them.  Attacking [ ]  At level 1 Heavy Melee , the cursed hammer deals a base damage of 60 HP and can be swung every 0.5 seconds. It has the ability to damage multiple mobs in one swing. There's also a small chance of landing a critical hit when using this weapon, meaning the attack will deal an extra 30 HP of damage and its damage can be increased by leveling up the Heavy Melee skill and it is in the striking and ethereal classes.  Healing [ ]  This weapon has a chance of healing when it's used, it can heal you and the players around you

title: Cutlass
content: Cutlass Type Light Melee Physical class Slashing Attack damage 18 HP (Base) +9 HP (Critical) Buy cost 100 skulls Description Once wielded by a sky pirate. The cutlass is a light melee weapon in the slashing class that could have been purchased from the Mercenary during the PvP Beta event.  Obtaining [ ]  Purchasing [ ]  The cutlass could have been purchased for 100 skulls from the Mercenary on PvP Island during the PvP Beta event.  Attacking [ ]  At level 1 Light Melee , the cutlass deals a base damage of 18 HP. It has the ability to damage multiple mobs in one swing and leaves behind a blue trail. There's also a small chance of landing a critical hit when using this weapon, meaning the attack will deal an extra 9 HP of damage. Its damage can be increased by leveling up the Light Melee skill and it is in the slashing class.  History [ ]  January 4, 2021 Added cutlasses. January 11, 2021 The cutlass is made unobtainable. February 19, 2021 Cutlasses are now able to be displayed on tool stands . September 17, 2022 Cutlasses are now a slashing weapon.  Trivia [ ]  The cutlass is the first limited weapon in the game. Before the February 19, 2021 update, players weren't able to display this on tool stands . The cutlass is the second and latest item sold by the Mercenary , the first being PvP Alpha trophy .

title: Davey
content: Davey Location Player's Island and Pirate Island Davey is a pirate added in the July 17, 2021 update.  Spawning [ ]  There is a 50% chance for Davey to spawn on the player's island every in-game season . (1:00 PM EST / 10:00 AM PST)  Shop [ ]  Image Name Cost Treasure Map 120 Doubloons  Dialogue [ ]  When the player interacts with Pirate Davey on the player's island:  "Yarr! My name's Davey! There's treasure buried somewhere and I need some help finding it! If you'd be so kind to help I'll let you keep the treasure!" >Maybe later End. >Help Davey (If the player has a treasure map) "Yar! Find your treasure and I'll be givin' you another map!" >Okay End. (If the player does not have a treasure map) "Yarr! use this map to find the treasure! You'll be needin' a shovel to dig it up. Good luck, I best be goin' then, my crew will be needin' me!" >Goodbye. Player receives a treasure map and Davey leaves the player's island. >Ask to leave island "Yarr! Best be goin' then, my crew will be needin' me!" >Nevermind, stay! Leaves the interface and Davey doesn't leave the player's island. >Goodbye. Davey leaves the player's island.  When the player interacts with Pirate Davey on the Pirate Island:  "Yarr user ! Could I be interestin' in you purchasin' a Treasure Map ?" >View Shop (If the player does not have a treasure map) Leads to the shop. (If the player has a treasure map) "Yarr, seems you already have a treasure hunt to be completin'!" >Okay End.  History [ ]  July 17, 2021 Davey is added. July 23, 2021 Fixed the issues causing Davey to visit the player's island more than once per day. Fixed Davey rag-dolling when approached by a player holding a sword in their hand. August 15, 2021 Correctly fixed the issue causing Davey to visit the player's island more than once per day. July 16, 2022 Fixed a bug that didn't allow Davey to give treasure maps after a treasure map was previously discarded in the trash can . August 20, 2022 Introduced a bug that prevented players from talking to Davey on player islands . Fixed the bug that prevented players from talking to Davey on player islands.  Trivia [ ]  New players will not get Davey on their island to prevent alt treasure farming. Before, there was a glitch where you could claim infinite Treasure Maps on someone else's island because Davey will not leave. However, this glitch was patched shortly after.  Gallery [ ]

title: Dead_Bush
content: Dead Bush Type of block Solid block Best tool Luminous Transparent A dead bush is a decorative block that naturally spawns around Desert Island .  Obtaining [ ]  Natural generation [ ]  Wild dead bushes spawn naturally around Desert Island . They can be harvested and placed on player islands .  Breaking [ ]  Dead Bush Breaking Data Hardness 1 Best Tool None Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 2 Wooden 3 3 Stone 2 2 Iron 1 1 Gilded Steel 1 1 Diamond 1 1 Opal 1 1 Void Mattock 1  Usage [ ]  Quests [ ]  Azur has a quest that involves breaking 15 dead bushes. When a player has completed this quest, they will be rewarded with 4 sand dollars.  Quest Reward Break 15 wild dead bushes. 4 Sand Dollars  History [ ]  August 9, 2020 Added dead bushes. April 24, 2021 Dead bushes no longer spawn on Desert Island . May 8, 2021 Dead bushes spawn on Desert Island again.  Trivia [ ]  The April 24, 2021 update revamped Desert Island, and in doing so, dead bushes accidently stopped spawning. This was later fixed on May 8, 2021 .

title: December_16_2022
content: December 16, 2022 Basic Information Day released December 16, 2022 Version number 111 Version Navigator Previous version Next version December 2, 2022 December 23, 2022 The December 16, 2022 update, also known as the Christmas Event 2022 Update I, is a major update in Islands that added content for the Christmas 2022 update.  Content [ ]  Additions [ ]  Added Party menu. Added Eddie . Added new furniture blocks: Added Santa plushies . Added gnome plushies . Added elf plushies . Added penguin plushies . Added reindeer plushies . Added white reindeer plushies . Added Christmas Event 2022 Trophy . Added gnomes . Added Santa Stockings. Added Elf Stockings. Added Snowman Stockings. Added Snowflake Stockings. Added Cookie Stockings. Added candy cane fences . Added candy cane light fences . Added candy cane scepters . Added penguin pet eggs . Added evil gingerbreads . Added Christmas present 2022s . Added ATMs .  Modifications [ ]  Projectiles can now be shot in any direction from the player through ranged weapons . Increased the sell price of carrots from 21 coins to 27 coins. Decreased the sell price of onions from 30 coins to 25 coins.  Bug fixes [ ]  Fixed bug causing collision issues with whiteboards and blackboards .  December 20, 2022 [ ]  Added a free present drop for the winning team in snowball fight . Added an "Assists" stat to snowball fight. Made changes to the reward tickets to account for eliminations + assists in snowball fight. Reduced the required eliminations to win in a snowball fight from 30 to 25. Buffed evil gingerbread mob damage from 12 to 16. Buffed evil gingerbread movement speed. Reduced evil gingerbread jump height. Added death markers for enemy and teammates. Fixed bug causing players to move after death. title: December_23_2022
content: December 23, 2022 Basic Information Day released December 23, 2022 Version number 112 Version Navigator Previous version Next version December 16, 2022 January 6, 2023 The December 23, 2022 update, also known as the Christmas Event 2022 Update II, is a major update in Islands that added Christmas quests , reworked Snowball Fight , and other event-related content.  Content [ ]  Additions [ ]  Added jolly daggers . Added new furniture blocks: Added Christmas lanterns . Added candy clusters . Added Christmas street lights . Added Christmas fence lights . Added Frost . Added “A Very Merry Day” quests : Added “Breezy Battles”. Added “Snow For The Gold”.  Modifications [ ]  Removed Slowness . Increased the sell price of watermelon from 80 coins to 85 coins. Decreased the sell price of lemon from 20 coins to 16 coins.  Snowball Fight reworks [ ]  Teams now spawn in caves that have 2 ways to exit Teams cannot enter other team's spawn or throw snowballs into their spawn Added a 5 minute timer to end the match Players without any kills and assists will not receive any rewards.  Bug fixes [ ]  Fixed a bug causing rewards to double in notifications. Fixed a bug causing players completing a new task to count for 5 instead of 1. title: December_29_2021
content: December 29, 2021 Basic Information Day released December 29, 2021 Version number 66 Version Navigator Previous version Next version December 18, 2021 January 8, 2022 The December 29, 2021 update is a minor update that temporarily disabled trading due to duping exploits and added numerous new Christmas-themed furniture blocks.  Changes [ ]  Additions [ ]  Added new furniture blocks: Bell Candy Cane Lamp Nutcracker Red Blue Green Train Bed Snowman Snowman Couch Snowman Bean Bag Added the ability to name island profiles  Modifications [ ]  Disabled trading Disabled item dropping for most items Disabled trading with other players through the trading menu Disabled all vending machine and vending machine tier 2 interactions Disabled manually placing items in the following blocks : Small Chest Medium Chest Large Chest Desert Chest Opened Treasure Chest Infernal Dragon Egg Cauldron Industrial Chest Input/Output Chest Input/Output Tier 2 Chest Timed Input/Output Chest Wooden Trough Metal Trough Automated Trough Christmas Tree Flower Pot (Pottery Bench) Berry Basket Industrial Berry Basket Steel Mill Copper Press Steel Press Small Fish Tank Medium Fish Tank Tool Stand Small Display Case Large Display Case Firework Launcher Mobile sprint has been moved to a toggle button Improved the notification UI Decreased the server crash shutdown threshold Increased maximum server size to 30. title: Deposit
content: Deposit may refer to:  Blocks [ ]  Copper Deposit ; a resource block that can be drilled for copper ore . Gold Deposit ; a resource block that can be drilled for gold ore . Oil Deposit ; a resource block that can be pumped for oil .  Locations [ ]  Resource Island ; a small island that may contain either a copper deposit, gold deposit, or oil deposit.

title: Desert_Chest
content: Desert Chest Type of block Solid block; Interactable Best tool Luminous Transparent Description A desert themed chest. The desert chest is an unobtainable desert-themed chest that can be used to hold up to 720 items .  Obtaining [ ]  Purchasing [ ]  Desert chests could have been purchased from Azur for 30 sand dollars each before the June 3, 2022 update.  Breaking [ ]  Desert Chest Breaking Data Hardness 6 Best Tool None Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 9 Wooden 18 18 Stone 10 10 Iron 6 6 Gilded Steel 5 5 Diamond 3 3 Opal 3 3 Void Mattock 2  Usage [ ]  Storage [ ]  A medium chest has 12 slots that can fit up to 60 items per slot, adding up to a total of 720 items per chest.  History [ ]  November 20, 2020 Added desert chests. December 29, 2021 Disabled manually placing items into desert chests. January 2, 2022 Re-enabled the ability to manually place items into desert chests. January 3, 2022 Disabled the ability to manually place items into desert chests. Re-enabled the ability to manually place items into desert chests. January 4, 2022 Disabled the ability to manually place items into desert chests. January 6, 2022 Re-enabled the ability to manually place items into desert chests. June 3, 2022 Desert chests can no longer be purchased from Azur .  Trivia [ ]  Despite having the exact same function as medium chests , desert chests have a slightly larger hitbox that prevents blocks from being placed directly in front of or behind it.

title: Desert_Furnace
content: Desert Furnace Type of block Solid block; Interactable Best tool None Luminous Transparent Description A desert themed small furnace. The desert furnace is an unobtainable heating device used to smelt, heat, or cook items and blocks . Its stats are identical to that of the small furnace .  Obtaining [ ]  Purchasing [ ]  Desert furnaces could have been purchased from Azur for 50 sand dollars each before the June 3, 2022, update.  Breaking [ ]  Desert Furnace Breaking Data Hardness 6 Best Tool None Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 9 Wooden 18 18 Stone 10 10 Iron 6 6 Gilded Steel 5 5 Diamond 3 3 Opal 3 3 Void Mattock 2  Usage [ ]  Heating, smelting, and cooking [ ]  Desert furnaces can be used to smelt, heat, or cook different items and blocks into other items and blocks. It has a total of three slots able to hold 50 items each — one slot on the top left for the item to be smelted, one in the top right for the smelted items, and one in the bottom row for fuel. When powered with coal or petrified petroleum , the desert furnace will activate for approximately xx seconds. During this time, it will begin smelting the queued items inside, taking xx seconds per item.  Input Output 1 Iron Ore 1 Iron Ingot 1 Gold Ore 1 Gold Ingot 1 Clay 1 Brick 1 Sand 1 Glass Block 1 Bamboo 1 Dried Bamboo 1 Grass 1 Dried Grass 1 Dough 1 Bread 1 Carrot 1 Roasted Carrot 1 Berry Dough 1 Berry Pie 1 Uncooked Pizza 1 Pizza 1 Carrot Cake Batter 1 Carrot Cake 1 Potato 1 Baked Potato 1 Uncooked Apple Pie 1 Apple Pie 1 Orange Cake Batter 1 Orange Cake 1 Lemon Bread Dough 1 Lemon Bread 1 Uncooked Starfruit Cake 1 Starfruit Cake 1 Uncooked Pineapple Pizza 1 Pineapple Pizza 1 Pancake Dough 1 Pancakes  History [ ]  November 20, 2020 Added desert furnaces. July 23, 2021 The desert furnace can now hold up to 5 fuel items per slot, up from 1 per slot. November 27, 2021 Desert furnaces can now cook pancake dough into pancakes . January 8, 2022 Desert furnaces can now cook uncooked pineapple pizzas into pineapple pizzas . April 1, 2022 Updated the GUI to have one slot for the unheated item, one for the final product, and one for the fuel instead of two for items and one for fuel. 50 items can now queued to be heated in a slot, up from 5. June 3, 2022 Desert furnaces can no longer be purchased from Azur .

title: Desert_Island
content: Desert Island Current Version 3 Version 2 Version 1 Required skill Level 36 Combat Resources Red Sandstone Sandstone Dead Bush Villagers Azur Amber Amir Maria Rick Mobs Iron Skorp Gold Skorp Ruby Skorp Fish Bhaa Desert Island is an island that can be accessed through the portal on Wizard Island , the void rift on Void Isles , a desert portal , or using a teleporter pad with a Desert Island orb or Bhaa orb after reaching level 36 Combat . It is inhabited by skorps and Bhaa and includes 4 fishing ponds.  Resources [ ]  Ores [ ]  Resources 1 2 3 Resources Sandstone Red Sandstone Dead Bush Mobs Iron Skorp Gold Skorp Ruby Skorp The following ore rocks spawn on Desert Island that can be broken by the player:  Sandstone Red Sandstone  Foliage [ ]  The following foliage spawn on Desert Island:  Dead Bush  Transport [ ]  Transport Spawn Void Rift Desert Island has three travel devices: one portal located in front of Azarath used to travel to Wizard Island ; a rift located northeast of Azarath used to travel to the Void Isles that only appears after starting the quest , "A strange formation..."; and a teleporter pad is located next to the Wizard Island portal, which can be used to teleport to various locations depending on the inserted orbs .  Portal to Wizard Island Rift to Void Isles Teleporter Pad  Mobs [ ]  Fish [ ]  Fish can be caught in four bodies of water found in Azarath , the Desert Oasis , and in Bhaa's Arena by fishing .  Hostile mobs [ ]  Desert Island contains three different types of skorps that spawn throughout unpopulated areas of the island. Void hounds will only spawn near the void rift once the player has started the quest , "A strange formation...".  Iron Skorp (75% chance of spawning) Gold Skorp (20% chance of spawning) Ruby Skorp (5% chance of spawning)  Bhaa [ ]  Bhaa is the boss of Desert island and can be found in his arena on a separate island accessed by crossing a fallen pillar across the spawn location of skorps .  Azarathian Serpent [ ]  The Azarathian Serpent is the mini-boss of Desert island and has a 20% chance of spawning every minute.  Villagers [ ]  Azarath [ ]  Azarath Azarath Azur & Amir Amber Fishing Pond Villagers Amir Amber Azur Maria Rick Mobs Fish Azarath is a small city where Azur , Amber , Amir , Maria , and Rick reside, located in front of or behind certain stands. A small fishing pond can be used for fishing in the city.  Terrain [ ]  Desert Oasis [ ]  Desert Oasis Mobs Fish The Desert Oasis is surrounded by patches of green vegetation and contains a large fishing pond.  Bhaa's Arena [ ]  Bhaa's Arena Mobs Bhaa Iron Skorp Gold Skorp Ruby Skorp Fish Bhaa 's arena is on an island across from the skorp spawn area.  The arena consists of temple-like ruins, an arch, and two small fishing ponds. Like the Wizard Boss , Bhaa 's arena doesn't have any spawning towers/pillars. A fallen pillar connects Bhaa's spawn area and the main island.  Trivia [ ]  Skorps have received many changes since the release of Desert Island. The number of skorps that can spawn has changed throughout revamps, going from 3, then down to 2, and then up to 4. Skorps used to despawn after a period of time. Desert Island still receives the same amount of rain as all other islands . Desert Island was the first mob island that was not named after the mob that inhabits it. On April 24, 2021 , dead bushes stopped spawning, yet Azur's quest to break 15 of them was not removed, rendering the quest impossible to complete until the May 8, 2021 update when they were re-added. From August 13, 2022 to September 24, 2022 , void hounds used to spawn on Desert Island. These void hounds only dealt 8 HP damage to players and were smaller in size than those on Void Isles .

title: Desert_Island_Key
content: The Desert Island Key was an item used to access the Desert Island . It had its functionality removed in the January 22, 2021 update and was later completely removed in the February 5, 2021 update.  Obtaining [ ]  Mob drops [ ]  The Desert Island Key was able to be obtained by killing Wizard Lizards with a drop chance of 10%. Wizard Lizards will no longer dropped the key after January 22, 2021 but existing copies could still be traded with other players until February 5, 2021 when the item was wiped from player's inventories .  Usage [ ]  The Desert Island Key was a one time use item that was consumed from the player's inventory when going through the Desert Portal on the Wizard Island .

title: Deviled_Eggs
content: Deviled Eggs Recipe 4 Egg 4 Mayonnaise Jar Crafted with Cooking Table Food Processor Effect +25% mining drop yield Sell price 1,984 - 2,976 coins Hot sell price 2,976 - 4,460 coins Required skill Level 20 Cooking Description Eat for +25% mining drop yield. Deviled eggs are food items that grants +25% mining drop yield when consumed.  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Deviled Eggs 4 Egg 4 Mayonnaise Jar Cooking Table Food Processor Level 20 Cooking  Usage [ ]  Eating [ ]  Eating deviled eggs grants +25% mining drop yield for 15 minutes.  Selling [ ]  Deviled eggs can be sold to Petur for 1,984 - 2,976 coins each, or 2,976 - 4,460 coins if deviled eggs are a hot offer.  History [ ]  February 26, 2021 Added deviled eggs. November 13, 2021 Changed the recipe from 1 egg and 1 mayonnaise jar to 4 eggs and 4 mayonnaise jars. Changed the base selling price from 620 coins to 2,480 coins. Changed the description from "Doesn't come with mustard..." to "Eat for +25% mining drop yield." November 29, 2021 Deviled eggs are now edible. January 8, 2022 Changed the base selling price from 2,480 coins to 2,976 - 4,460 coins. January 15, 2022 Changed the base selling price from 2,976 - 4,460 coins to 1,984 - 2,976 coins.  Trivia [ ]  Although the item name is in plural form, deviled eggs are only shown as half of a single egg. Although herbs aren't in the recipe and don't exist in the game, some herbs are sprinkled on the egg. Before the November 13, 2021 update, selling this would give less coins than selling the ingredients individually.

title: Diamond
content: Diamond Diamond Rock Spawns When Kor is killed or naturally spawning throughout the Diamond Mines Description Excavated from the Diamond Mines A diamond is an item obtained by breaking its respective rock . It is used to craft various items and blocks .  Obtaining [ ]  Mining [ ]  Diamond rocks naturally generate in the Diamond Mines and Emerald Mines . Mining a diamond rock yields 1 diamond after each stage and 57 Mining XP (225 with the 4x daily bonus or 6 when maxed out), resulting in a total of 2 diamonds and 225 Mining XP (450 with the 4x daily bonus or 12 when maxed out) per rock.  Each diamond rock has a 0.25% - 0.5% chance of spawning as an enchanted diamond rock .  Mob drop [ ]  Four diamond rocks spawn upon killing Kor . Each rock that spawns has a 2% chance of being an enchanted diamond rock.  Breaking [ ]  Diamond Rock Breaking Data Hardness 100 Best Tool Pickaxe Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 150 Wooden 300 150 Stone 160 100 Iron 100 63 Gilded Steel 70 50 Diamond 50 30 Opal 40 20 Void Mattock 20  Usage [ ]  Crafting ingredient [ ]  Image Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Diamond Mines Orb 10 Glass Block 30 Diamond 2 Enchanted Diamond Workbench Tier 2 Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Level 46 Combat Diamond Block 10 Diamond Workbench Tier 2 Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 None Diamond Pickaxe 5 Gilded Steel Rod 50 Diamond Anvil Level 48 Mining Diamond Axe 5 Gilded Steel Rod 50 Diamond Anvil Level 44 Woodcutting Diamond War Hammer 5 Gilded Steel Rod 80 Diamond 10 Enchanted Diamond Anvil Level 46 Heavy Melee Diamond Great Sword 5 Gilded Steel Rod 80 Diamond 10 Enchanted Diamond Anvil Level 46 Light Melee Diamond Sickle 3 Gilded Steel Rod 25 Diamond Anvil Level 50 Farming Diamond Disco Ball 1 Diamond 10 Electrite Electrical Workbench None File:Pet Egg Stand 1 Render 2000x2000.png White Pet Egg Stand 7 Golden Plate 2 Glass Block 1 Diamond Workbench Tier 4 None File:Pet Egg Stand 2 Render 2000x2000.png Cyan Pet Egg Stand 7 Golden Plate 2 Cyan Glass Block 1 Diamond Workbench Tier 4 None Red Pet Egg Stand 7 Golden Plate 2 Red Glass Block 1 Diamond Workbench Tier 4 None Blue Pet Egg Stand 7 Golden Plate 2 Blue Glass Block 1 Diamond Workbench Tier 4 None Large Diamond Chest 30 Diamond 5 Enchanted Diamond 20 Steel Plate 15 Steel Bolt Workbench Tier 4 None Expanded Diamond Chest 50 Diamond 10 Enchanted Diamond 40 Steel Plate 30 Steel Bolt Workbench Tier 4 None Diamond ATM 1 Pink Sticky Gear 3 Blue Sticky Gear 5 Diamond 25 Electrite Workbench Tier 4 None  History [ ]  February 12, 2021 Added diamonds. April 9, 2022 Diamonds can now be used to craft Diamond Mines orbs . July 9, 2022 Fixed a bug that caused the diamonds in diamond rocks to float instead of embedding into the rock. October 28, 2022 Diamonds can now be used to craft diamond disco balls . November 4, 2022 Diamonds can now be used to craft pet egg stands , large diamond chests , and expanded diamond chests . December 16, 2022 Diamonds can now be used to craft diamond ATMs .  Trivia [ ]  This is the only ore to have an "enchanted" variant, while other ores have a " crystallized " variant or no variant at all.  Gallery [ ]

title: Diamond_Great_Sword
content: Diamond Great Sword Type Light Melee Physical class Slashing Attack damage 28 HP (Base) +14 (Critical) Recipe 80 Diamond 5 Gilded Steel Rod 10 Enchanted Diamond Crafted with Anvil Required skill Level 46 Light Melee Description Artifact sword forged from enchanted diamonds. The diamond great sword is a light melee weapon in the slashing class.  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Diamond Great Sword 80 Diamond 5 Gilded Steel Rod 10 Enchanted Diamond Anvil Level 46 Light Melee  Behavior [ ]  Attacking [ ]  At Light Melee level 1, the diamond great sword deals a base damage of 28 HP and can be swung every 0.5 seconds. It has the ability to damage multiple mobs in one swing. There's also a small chance of landing a critical hit when using this weapon, meaning the attack will deal an extra 14 HP of damage. Its damage can be increased by leveling up the Light Melee skill and it is in the slashing class.  Like other melee weapon , only one player can hit damage in each hostile mob. Multiple players cannot hit damage together.  History [ ]  February 12, 2021 Added diamond great swords. September 17, 2022 Diamond great swords are now a slashing weapon.  Trivia [ ]  It has the same crafting recipe as the diamond war hammer . There were three earlier concepts for the diamond great sword, seen in the image to the right. The three diamond great sword concepts.

title: Diamond_Mines
content: Diamond Mines Required skill Level 46 Combat Resources Iron Ore Gold Ore Copper Ore Diamond Enchanted Diamond Villagers Jed Mobs Coal Rock Mimic Iron Rock Mimic Gold Rock Mimic Kor The Diamond Mines is an island that can be accessed through a portal on Buffalkor Island , a Diamond Mines portal , Diamond Mines orb , or a Kor orb . It is inhabited by Kor and has island-exclusive ores; diamond and enchanted diamond . Level 46 Combat is required to access the Diamond Mines.  Resources [ ]  Ores [ ]  The following ores spawn in the Diamond Mines can be broken by the player:  Iron Ore Gold Ore Copper Ore Diamond Enchanted Diamond  Four diamond rocks spawn after killing Kor , and there is a slight chance of an enchanted diamond rock spawning in place of a normal diamond rock.  Portals [ ]  The Diamond Mines only has one portal which is used to teleport the player to and from Buffalkor Island . A teleporter pad near this portal can be used to teleport to and from the Diamond Mines.  Mobs [ ]  Rock Mimic [ ]  Coal , iron , and gold rock mimics spawn throughout the Diamond Mines disguised as a coal , iron , gold rock .  Kor [ ]  Kor can be found in the Diamond Mines. Once defeated, four diamond rocks will emerge from the ground, with a small chance of a diamond rock being an enchanted diamond rock . Kor has a cooldown period of 90 minutes (1 hour and 30 minutes) that can be bypassed with 500 Kor tokens .  Villagers [ ]  Jed [ ]  Jed is a villager located in front of a cabin near the entrance of the Diamond Mines. He does not have any quests and does not sell nor buy anything. His only purpose is to provide the player with information on how to get diamonds .  Layout [ ]  The Diamond Mines entrance is located inside the Buffalkor Island cave, near the Wizard Island Portal .  Inside, the cave is full of gold , iron, copper , and rarely, diamond rocks . Different paths and tunnels with tall roofs twist around the island. The house of the Jed NPC can be found near the entrance to the mine. A greyish-blur fog covers the island.  An elevated tunnel in the right of the Jed's house leads the player to the platform above the void. Between the 2 ancient pillars, the player can hold F (keyboard), hold tap (mobile), or hold X (Xbox) to evoke Kor and start the boss fight.  Near the circular platform there is a pond. As of February 19, 2021 Update, there are no fish in it.  The Diamond Mines have one opening leading to daylight overhead, and it is possible to explore the surface of the island by finding a small rock tunnel leading to outdoors, entered via one of the underground caverns. However there are no items to be found there.  Trivia [ ]  The void under the Kor bossfight platform deals 1,001 damage if the player falls into it, instantly killing them. It is one of the two forms of environmental damage in Islands , the other being lava pools in the Underworld . Instead of playing "A Day in the Sky" like other mob islands, the Diamond Mines plays "Beach Day" instead.  Gallery [ ]

title: Diamond_Mines_Portal
content: Diamond Mines Portal Type of block Solid block; Interactable Recipe 1 Diamond Mines Portal Shard 15 Enchanted Diamond 150 Stone Brick Crafted with Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Required skill Level 46 Combat (To use) Best tool Luminous Transparent Description A placeable portal that allows quick-travel to Diamond Mines. The diamond mines portal is a placeable portal that allow players to directly travel to the Diamond Mines through the player's island .  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Diamond Mines Portal 1 Diamond Mines Portal Shard 15 Enchanted Diamond 150 Stone Brick Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4  Breaking [ ]  Diamond Mines Portal Breaking Data Hardness 35 Best Tool None Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 53 Wooden 105 105 Stone 56 56 Iron 35 35 Gilded Steel 25 25 Diamond 18 18 Opal 14 14 Void Mattock 7  Usage [ ]  Traveling [ ]  When a player touches the purple part of the portal, they will be teleported to the Diamond Mines . If their Combat level is below 46, a UI element will pop-up telling them they do not have a high enough Combat level to enter, and it won't teleport the player.

title: Diamond_Mines_Portal_Shard
content: Diamond Mines Portal Shard Dropped by Kor Description Rare elemental item used to craft portals. The diamond mines portal shard is an item used to craft the diamond mines portal .  Obtaining [ ]  Mob drop [ ]  Kor has a 0.5% of dropping a diamond mines portal shard upon defeat.  Usage [ ]  Crafting ingredient [ ]  Image Name Recipe Crafting station Diamond Mines Portal 1 Diamond Mines Portal Shard 15 Enchanted Diamond 150 Stone Brick Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4  History [ ]  February 12, 2021 Added diamond mines portal shards.  Trivia [ ]  The shard has the highest drop chance out of all portal shards . Being introduced after island keys were removed on February 5, 2021 , this is the only portal shard to not have its appearance shared with an island key. The shard has the second longest name in Islands. With 26 letters.

title: Diamond_War_Hammer
content: Diamond War Hammer Type Heavy Melee Physical class Striking Attack damage 32 HP (Base) +16 HP (Critical) Recipe 80 Diamond 5 Gilded Steel Rod 10 Enchanted Diamond Crafted with Anvil Required skill Level 46 Heavy Melee Description Artifact hammer forged from enchanted diamonds. The diamond war hammer is a heavy melee weapon in the striking class.  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Diamond War Hammer 80 Diamond 5 Gilded Steel Rod 10 Enchanted Diamond Anvil Level 46 Heavy Melee  Attacking [ ]  At Heavy Melee level 1, the diamond war hammer deals a base damage of 32 HP and can be swung every 0.5 seconds. It has the ability to damage multiple mobs in one swing. There's also a small chance of landing a critical hit when using this weapon, meaning the attack will deal an extra 16 HP of damage. Its damage can be increased by leveling up the Heavy Melee skill and it is in the striking class.  Like other melee weapon , only one player can hit damage in each hostile mob. Multiple players cannot hit damage together.  History [ ]  February 12, 2021 Added diamond war hammers. September 17, 2022 Diamond war hammers are now a striking weapon.  Trivia [ ]  The diamond war hammer shares the same crafting recipe as the diamond great sword .

title: Diorite
content: Diorite Diorite Rock Type of block Solid block Spawns Hub Best tool Luminous Transparent Diorite is a block that can be mined from a diorite rock .  Obtaining [ ]  Mining [ ]  Diorite rocks naturally generate in the mining zone in the Hub . Mining a diorite rock yields 2 - 4 diorite after each stage and 3 Mining XP (6 with the 4x daily bonus), resulting in a total of 4 - 8 diorite and 9 Mining XP (18 with the 4x daily bonus) per rock.  Totem [ ]  Diorite totems can be purchased from Arius in the Hub for 8,000 coins . A diorite totem will spawn diorite rocks around it when placed, or if placed next to a conveyor belt , the totem will drop diorite directly onto the conveyor.  Breaking [ ]  Diorite Breaking Data Hardness 8 Best Tool Pickaxe Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 12 Wooden 24 12 Stone 13 8 Iron 8 5 Gilded Steel 6 4 Diamond 4 3 Opal 4 2 Void Mattock 2 Diorite Rock Breaking Data Hardness 14 Best Tool Pickaxe Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 21 Wooden 42 21 Stone 23 14 Iron 14 9 Gilded Steel 10 7 Diamond 7 5 Opal 6 3 Void Mattock 3  Usage [ ]  Crafting ingredient [ ]  Image Name Recipe Crafting station 2 Diorite Stair 1 Diorite Workbench Tier 2 Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 2 Diorite Slab 1 Diorite Workbench Tier 2 Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4  Transforming [ ]  Diorite can be transformed into diorite bricks in a stonecutter or an industrial stonecutter or smooth diorite in a polishing station or a industrial polishing station . April 16, 2022 Fixed the texture of diorite rocks.  Trivia [ ]  Before April 16, 2022 , the texture of diorite rocks matched the red color of granite instead being white.

title: Dodo_Fossil_Statue
content: Dodo Fossil Statue Buy cost 55 Ruby Skorp Scales The dodo fossil statue is one of the fossil statues that can be bought from Azur .  Obtaining [ ]  Purchasing [ ]  It can be purchased from Azur in The Azarathian Desert for 55 ruby skorp scales .  Breaking [ ]  Unknown...  Fossil Parts [ ]  The Dodo Bird fossil parts to complete the statue are obtained by breaking special Fossil Rocks found throughout the different islands. The locations for the different parts are listed when right-clikcing on the fossil statue. (When placed down, not in inventory)  History [ ]  July 21, 2023 Added Dodo Fossil Statue.

title: Dog_Pet_Spawn_Egg
content: Dog Pet Spawn Egg A dog pet spawn egg is a spawn egg used to spawn a dog pet . It, unlike other pet eggs, can be traded.  Obtaining [ ]  Tailyah [ ]  From April 14, 2023 - April 28, 2023 , Taliyah visited players islands during Islands' 3 year anniversary . Interacting with her on the player's own island will reward them the pet spawn egg.  Usage [ ]  Spawning [ ]  To spawn a dog pet , the player must be the owner of the island they are currently on. While holding the egg, clicking or tapping anywhere on their screen will spawn a dog pet.  History [ ]  April 14, 2023 Added dog pet spawn eggs. April 28, 2023 Dog pet spawn eggs are now unobtainable. ??? Dog pet spawn eggs are now tradable.  NOTE: The "???" history is unconfirmed and gone off what the community has said.  (The comment says that they aren't tradable, and previously, this page also said it wasn't tradable, which isn't true now)

title: Dom
content: Dom is a villager located in the Hub . Players can sell crates of crops or fruits and pallets to him.  Shop [ ]  Dom buys crates and pallets for various prices in exchange for coins . Each sale is sold at a higher value than if sold individually to Cletus or John . Once it is fully grown I will bring it to town." >Oh.. Okay. End. >Talk about mystery "There's something big coming... but it's not my creature!" >Okay! End.  History [ ]  June 4, 2021 Added Dom. September 5, 2021 Dom is given new dialogue about the "mystery". October 9, 2021 Dom now purchases plum crates . October 18, 2021 Removed dialogue about the "mystery". January 8, 2022 Lowered the selling price of normal and large crop crates. January 15, 2022 Increased the selling price of crates and large crates of starfruit from 5,400 coins and 15,187 coins to 7,200 coins and 20,250 coins respectively. April 1, 2022 Increased the selling price of crates of tomatoes from 1,080 coins to 1,800 coins. May 13, 2022 Lowered the selling price of regular and large watermelon crates from 9,600 coins and 27,000 coins to 9,000 coins and 25,312 coins respectively. Increased the selling price of regular and large kiwi crates from 4,800 coins and 15,000 coins to 6,400 coins and 20,000 coins respectively. July 30, 2022 Dom now purchases pineapple , cactus , and spinach crates. October 1, 2022 Lowered the selling price of regular and large tomato crates from x and x coins to 480 coins and 1,350 coins respectively. Increased the selling price of regular and large pineapple crates from x and x coins to 11,520 and 32,400 coins respectively. January 20, 2023 Dom now purchases cherry blossom pallets .  Trivia [ ]  The large creature that Dom claims he is raising may suggest an update in the future or an upcoming event. It may also be a nod to Islands' sister games, Bedwars. In Bedwars, there is a kit named Dino Tamer Dom . Dom's creature loves pineapples , as suggested in one of his dialogues. His creature also seems to like watermelons and carrots , as one of his dialogues reads "Could use some more large melon crates... carrots too."

title: Don
content: Don Location Maple Isles Purpose Taking players to the Maple Isles and leading them to Fhanhorn's battle arena. Occupation Maple Captain Don is a villager . She allows players to travel from the main area of Maple Isles to Fhanhorn's battle arena. The player has to complete all of Bailey's quests and Emma's quests for her to let the player travel to the battle arena.  Questline [ ]  Don requires the player to make 50 berry pancakes to prove their commitment. After the player gives her the pancakes, she will then allow the player to access Fhanhorn's battle arena.  Guide: To make these pancakes, the player will need a minimum of 300 blueberries , 300 raspberries , and 50 sweet pancakes (which are made of 50 pancakes and 150 maple syrup bottles ).  Tip: when doing this quest, be sure that your cooking level is high because you can get a lot more with making berries pancake.  Dialogue [ ]  Hub [ ]  "Hey there user ! Would you like to travel to Maple Island [sic] ?" >Travel to Maple Island [sic] . Takes player to the Maple Isles.  Maple Isles [ ]  Predialogue [ ]  "I'm not sending mere visitors up to that island..." >... End  First Interaction [ ]  "I hear you helped out my family." >Yup "I've seen countless chefs go up there and never come back. Bring me 50 berry pancakes to prove your commitment" >On it End >What's up there " The guardian of the Maple Isles... Fhanhorn." > ... " Many aspiring chefs have taken this path to try to cook Fhanhorns pancakes..." > Why? " The legends say that those pancakes will give the Might of Fhanhorn... Those under its effect can find legendary antler weapons." > ..! Takes you back to beginning of dialogue  During Quest [ ]  TBD  Completion [ ]  "I see you were able to make those berry pancakes." >Yup "You travel at your own risk... " > Maybe Later End. > What's up there? " The guardian of the Maple Isles... Fhanhorn." > ... " Many aspiring chefs have taken this path to try to cook Fhanhorns pancakes..." > Why? " The legends say that those pancakes will give the Might of Fhanhorn... Those under its effect can find legendary antler weapons." > ..! Takes you back to beginning of dialogue > [Travel to Fhanhorn] Takes you to Fhanhorn's isle.  Following interactions [ ]  "You travel at your own risk... " > Maybe Later End. > What's up there? " The guardian of the Maple Isles... Fhanhorn." > ... " Many aspiring chefs have taken this path to try to cook Fhanhorns pancakes..." > Why? " The legends say that those pancakes will give the Might of Fhanhorn... Those under its effect can find legendary antler weapons." > ..! Takes you back to beginning of dialogue > [Travel to Fhanhorn] Takes you to Fhanhorn's isle.  History [ ]  November 27, 2021 Added Don. July 16, 2022 Don can now be seen in the Hub . Don can now take players to the Maple Isles . Added dialogue for interacting in the Hub. Changed Don's title from "Maple Warrior" to "Maple Captain".

title: Doubloon
content: Doubloon Dropped by Bandit Angry Crab Description The currency of choice for Pirate Island . Doubloons are the main currency on Pirate Island , granting the player the ability to trade with most pirates on the island. It cannot be dropped, traded , or put in vending machines and chests .  Obtaining [ ]  Mob drop [ ]  Angry crabs and bandits are guaranteed to drop one doubloon upon defeat. title: Dragon_(disambiguation)
content: Dragon may refer to:  Item [ ]  Dragon Fruit Seeds ; an item that can be planted in a trellis to grow dragon fruit . Dragon Pet Spawn Egg ; a spawn egg used to spawn a dragon pet . Infernal Dragon Orb ; an item that can be placed in a teleporter pad to teleport the player to the Infernal Dragon spawn area . The Dragonslayer ; a Heavy Melee weapon that can be used to attack mobs .  Crop [ ]  Dragon Fruit ; a crop that can be sold to Cletus .  Block [ ]  Infernal Dragon Egg ; a roulette block that is dropped by the Infernal Dragon .  Food [ ]  Dragon Fruit Acai Bowl Dragon Fruit Ice Cream Dragon Roll ; a food item that increases chances of getting loot from mobs .  Mob [ ]  Dragon Pet ; a pet that can be spawned by using a dragon pet spawn egg. Infernal Dragon ; a boss that can be spawned in the Underworld .

title: Dragon_Fruit
content: Dragon Fruit Seed cost 5,000 coins Planted on Trellis Sell price 45 coins Required skill Level 41 Farming (to sell) Edible A dragon fruit is a crop that grows on trellises from dragon fruit seeds .  Obtaining [ ]  Harvesting [ ]  Harvesting a dragon fruit vine yields 1 - 4 dragon fruits, 1 dragon fruit seed , and 27 Farming XP (108 XP with the 4x daily bonus). The chance of obtaining more than one dragon fruit per plant is increased by the player's Farming level and for owners of the VIP gamepass . Extra dragon fruit seeds cannot be yielded.  Totems [ ]  A dragon fruit totem will collect and replant dragon fruits in a 3-block radius, which can then be collected by interacting it. A dragon fruit totem placed next to a conveyor belt will drop the dragon fruits onto the conveyor. This process cannot yield extra dragon fruit seeds.  Growth [ ]  The growth time of dragon fruits can be shortened by 20% when watered with a watering can or basic sprinkler , or fertilized with basic fertilizer . If watered and fertilized, the growth time will be shortened by 30%. Renamed "Dragon Fruit Harvested" to "Dragon Fruit." May 20, 2022 Changed the sell price of dragon fruits from 45 coins to 52 coins. October 15, 2022 Dragon fruits can now be sold to Tom instead of to Cletus.  Trivia [ ]  Dragon fruit was referred to as "Dragon Fruit Harvested" for a few minutes in-game when the February 27, 2022 update was released. Dragon fruit are also known as "Pitaya" or "Pitahaya" in countries where it's natively found. The vines from a dragon fruit are actually a type of cacti known as Selenicereus costaricensis . It name of this item in-game is "Dragon Fruit Vine".

title: Dragon_Roll
content: Dragon Roll Recipe 1 Sushi Roll 2 Cut Eel 2 Avocado Crafted with Cooking Table Food Processor Effect +30% reward luck in combat Required skill Level 72 Cooking Description Consume for +30% reward luck in combat. The dragon roll is a food item that grants +30% reward luck from defeating mobs when consumed.  It cannot be sold to Petur .  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Dragon Roll 1 Sushi Roll 2 Cut Eel 2 Avocado Cooking Table Food Processor Level 72 Cooking  Usage [ ]  Eating [ ]  Eating a dragon roll grants +30% reward luck when defeating mobs for 15 minutes.  Upon defeating a mob, the luck effect granted from consuming a dragon roll increases the chance of mob drops by 30% of its original value, meaning it multiplies the drop rate of items from mobs by 1.3x. For example, an item with a 0.35% drop chance will now have a 0.455% chance of dropping. Items with a 100% drop rate will be increased to 130%, meaning that it has a guaranteed chance of dropping one and an additional 30% chance of dropping another.  Its luck effect can be stacked with the looting bonus granted from using the captain's rapier and consuming a blueberry cookie , allowing a maximum increase of 180%, or 1.8x, to be applied to a mob drop. title: Drill
content: Drill Type of block Solid block; Interactable Recipe 1 Crystallized Iron 1 Blue Sticky Gear 8 Steel Rod Crafted with Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Required skill Level 18 Forging Best tool Luminous Transparent Description Autominer that extracts from resource deposit islands. Powered by coal. A drill is an industrial machine used to drill copper and gold ore from copper and gold deposits .  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Drill 1 Crystallized Iron 1 Blue Sticky Gear 8 Steel Rod Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Level 18 Forging  Breaking [ ]  Drill Breaking Data Hardness 50 Best Tool None Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 75 Wooden 150 150 Stone 80 80 Iron 50 50 Gilded Steel 35 35 Diamond 25 25 Opal 20 20 Void Mattock 10  Usage [ ]  Drilling [ ]  To use a drill, it first must be powered with coal or petrified petroleum , either manually or via its conveyor input with a coal totem . Doing so will power the drill for approximately 30 seconds. Drills can only drill copper or gold deposits , and after placing it on top of a deposit and powering it, it will start extracting copper or gold ore respectively and output it from its output conveyor. It takes 5 seconds to extract a copper ore and 2 minutes to extract a gold ore.  History [ ]  September 18, 2020 Added drills.  Trivia [ ]  The drill animations will break if the player starts and stops it twice without leaving the game or breaking it. The drill has small meters that start to move around once the drill is fueled. Before the January 22, 2021 update, the drill used to take 50 seconds to drill out gold ore from a gold deposit .

title: Duck
content: Duck Behavior Passive Effect Speed (+25% when mounted) Location Player's Island A duck is a small passive mob added in the February 19, 2022 update. It can be spawned from a duck spawn egg and can be mounted for a 25% speed boost when fully grown.  It is the sixth animal passive mob in Islands .  Spawning [ ]  Ducks can be spawned through a duck spawn egg , which can be bought from Taliyah once the player has reached level 40 in the Animal Care skill. Higher-tier eggs can be obtained by breeding two ducks.  Behavior [ ]  Laying eggs [ ]  Ducks will lay infertile duck eggs shortly after being fed with their favorite foods or bread . If there is a nest or the industrial nest nearby it might lay an egg in it, but it's not guaranteed. Duck eggs laid in a nest or on a grass block will not despawn.  Sleeping [ ]  When it becomes night in-game, ducks will go to sleep. While they can sleep anywhere and sometimes will, they prefer to sleep on a nest.  Following [ ]  Ducks will follow players that are holding bread .  Breeding [ ]  After two ducks have been given a potion of fertility each, they will breed, creating a duck spawn egg . The egg will be of a tier between 1 and 3.  Inspecting [ ]  Ducks can be inspected to show a menu that allows the player to see information about the duck, listed below:  Mount Sell value Information Food level Favorite foods Happiness level Traits (fertility, productivity, and friendliness) Personality  Feeding [ ]  Ducks can be fed approximately every ?? - ?? seconds. Ducks eat bread , but will also each have their favorite foods . The foods a duck can have as its favorite food are pizza , baked potato , potato salad , roasted carrots , and roasted honey carrots .  Feeding a duck will increase its food and friendliness level. The food level is necessary to keep above 20% or the duck will start losing happiness.  A wooden trough , metal trough , or automated trough can be used to feed ducks.  Like other animals , if no troughs are in its vicinity, it will eat from a grass block , but doing so will not replenish its hunger meter nor give Animal Care XP.  Petting [ ]  A duck can be pet every 5 minutes which increases its happiness level. The action yields 5 Animal Care XP (18 with the 4x daily bonus).  Mounting [ ]  Ducks can be mounted via the button in the inspect menu if the player is level 8 or higher in Animal Care. A mounted duck can be ridden anywhere within the server. If the duck is dismounted outside the player's island or falls into the void, the duck will respawn on the island spawn point. Mounting a duck will grant a 25% speed boost to the player, which can be stacked with chili peppers , potato and duck egg scrambles , the speed boost of horses , yaks or vultures and sweet rice desserts . When the player taking any damage while mounting a duck, it will no longer automatically be dismounted.  Personality [ ]  Ducks are assigned a personality upon spawning. All personalities have the same probability, except for resourceful which is more uncommon.  Personality Description Effects Trivia Lazy "Your duck is lazy. They sleep for a long time, but gain a bit of happiness while sleeping." Duck will sleep during the afternoon and evening, but will still gain happiness while sleeping. Level-headed "Your duck is level-headed. They will not gain or lose happiness quickly." Self-Explanatory Loyal "Your duck is loyal. They are extra happy around players and animals but can become very lonely when left alone." Ducks will gain happiness faster if players and/ or animals are within an unknown number blocks, but will lose happiness fast if they are further than that threshold. Friendly "Your duck is friendly. They will bring you extra gifts." Unknown Resourceful "Woah! Your duck is resourceful. They will produce items faster than other animals." Ducks will make products faster than normal. This is the rarest personality.  History [ ]  February 19, 2022 Added ducks. Introduced where ducks are now able to eat grass blocks . April 9, 2022 Fixed a bug that prevented ducks from eating from wooden troughs , metal troughs , or automated troughs .  Trivia [ ]  Like yaks , ducks were unable to eat from a wooden trough , metal trough , or an automated trough . This was fixed in the April 9, 2022 update. Ducks are able to move with sleeping animation, but this can be fixed by mounting and dismounting. Like all other animals, ducks may eat from a grass blocks instead of from troughs, but doing so will not replenish their hunger meter nor give Animal Care XP. This can be done if no troughs are nearby. The eating sound of ducks is reduced when eating grass blocks.  Like yaks and horses , if a player mounts another animal while being mounted on a duck, they will be bugged and have the speed boost even when off the animal. This is due to the effect is removed only when dismounting a duck  Contrary to the duck spawn egg's description, ducks cannot be fed wheat . Ducks share many things with other animals . Ducks have the same eye model as turkeys , yaks, horses, and the old model of cows . Ducks have the same animations, amount of Animal Care XP, and favorite foods as chickens . Ducks were the first and only animal that has a processed food, bread , as their primary food; all other animals prefer raw crops . Like yaks and horses, there was a bug where the extra boosts granted when mounting a duck will wear off when joining other servers. This was fixed in the July 9, 2022 Update. Ducks were the first animal that granted a speed boost when mounted. Ducks were reported jittering when close to players, causing them to fling off the map or despawn, this was later fixed. Unlike chickens, ducks could collision with eggs or duck eggs into nests .

title: Duck_Egg
content: Duck Egg Sell price 300 coins Required skill Level 40 Animal Care (to sell) Description Infertile egg laid by ducks. A duck egg is an item laid by ducks .  Obtaining [ ]  Ducks [ ]  Adult and baby ducks will lay duck eggs shortly after being fed with their favorite foods or bread . Ducks will lay their eggs in a nest if it is accessible and hasn't reached its max capacity of 3.  If there is no nest that is able to accommodate an extra egg, the duck will lay its egg on a random block on the player's island . Each block is only able to hold one egg.  Usage [ ]  Cooking [ ]  Cooking a duck egg in a campfire , small furnace , or desert furnace will create a poached duck egg .  Input Output 1 Duck Egg 1 Poached Duck Egg  Selling [ ]  Duck eggs can be sold to Taliyah for 300 coins each after reaching level 40 Animal Care .  History [ ]  February 19, 2022 Added duck eggs.  Trivia [ ]  Whenever a duck egg is laid from a duck , an item port spawns with it, keeping the egg from despawning. Unlike eggs , duck eggs are the first and only egg in Islands that cannot be manually placed into nests .

title: Duck_Spawn_Egg
content: Duck Spawn Egg Buy cost Tier 1: 15,000 coins Required skill Tier 1: Level 40 Animal Care (to buy) Description Spawn a duck with tier 1/2/3 trait maximums. Eats bread. The duck spawn egg is a spawn egg used to spawn ducks on player islands . There are 3 tiers of the egg; one can be bought while the other two can only be obtained through breeding ducks.  Obtaining [ ]  Purchasing [ ]  Tier 1 duck spawn eggs can be purchased from Taliyah for 15,000 coins each after reaching level 40 Animal Care .  Breeding [ ]  Any tier of this egg can be obtained by breeding two ducks. To breed ducks, the player must feed them each a potion of fertility during the day (in-game). The traits of the two animals will determine the tier of the spawn egg.  Usage [ ]  Spawning [ ]  Players can only spawn ducks if they have not reached the small animal limit and are the owner of the island they are on. While holding the egg, they can click/tap anywhere on their screen to spawn a duck.  History [ ]  February 19, 2022 Added duck spawn eggs.  Trivia [ ]  Duck spawn eggs are the third-most expensive item the player can buy from Taliyah , the most being yak spawn eggs . The turkey spawn egg tier 2 used to share the same model as duck spawn eggs before April 16, 2022 .

title: Dungeon_Chest
content: Dungeon Chest Type of block Solid block; Interactable Dropped by Primordial Slime Best tool Luminous Transparent Description A special chest from the Dungeons to place on your island and open!  A Dungeon Chest is a roulette block that contains slime-related items .  Obtaining [ ]  Slime Dungeon [ ]  All players who have killed at least 3 slimes and completed the Slime Dungeon will get 1 dungeon chest upon completion.  Breaking [ ]  Dungeon Chest Breaking Data Hardness 6 Best Tool None Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 9 Wooden 18 18 Stone 10 10 Iron 6 6 Gilded Steel 5 5 Diamond 3 3 Opal 3 3 Void Mattock 2  Loot [ ]  Dungeon chests can be opened by holding the open button once it has been placed. When opened, the dungeon chest will scroll through the items like a roulette wheel and reward one item, similar to its counterpart, the Treasure Chest . Once the item has been collected, the chest will turn into an Opened Dungeon Chest and can be used as a normal chest.  The listed reward chances are community made and may not be accurate .
