title: Industrial_Chest
content: Industrial Chest Type of block Solid block; Interactable Recipe 1 Conveyor Belt 30 Iron Ingot 1 Medium Chest Crafted with Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Required skill Level 8 Forging Best tool Luminous Transparent Description Medium sized chest with a conveyor attachment. Industrial chests are one of the two ways to have automatic storage, they were added in the May 2, 2020 Automation update. The chest can be changed from a chest to a dispenser by pressing the direction button. It can hold up to five items per slot and contains 12 slots meaning it can hold a maximum of 60 items.  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Industrial Chest 1 Conveyor Belt 30 Iron Ingot 1 Medium Chest Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Level 8 Forging  Jack [ ]  Upon creating the first steel mill , Jack will visit the player's island and will reward the player with one industrial chest and eight conveyor belts .  Breaking [ ]  Industrial Chest Breaking Data Hardness 5.5 Best Tool Pickaxe Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 9 Wooden 17 9 Stone 9 6 Iron 6 4 Gilded Steel 4 3 Diamond 3 2 Opal 3 2 Void Mattock 2  Usage [ ]  Storage [ ]  To store items set the chest's "Direction: In" and hook up any conveyor output to the chest's input. To dispense items/blocks change the "Direction:Out" and any item/block filled inside of it will be outputted, about one item a second.  History [ ]  May 2, 2020 Added industrial chests. May 10, 2020 Saved industrial chest's output direction when rejoining. December 29, 2021 Disabled manually placing items into industrial chests. April 22, 2022 Fixed the collision box of the industrial chest. May 20, 2022 Industrial chests can no longer dispense items. May 21, 2022 Industrial chests can dispense items again.  Trivia [ ]  The conveyor attachment's arrows will always point inwards even if the mode is set to "out". Despite being crafted with a medium chest which can hold 60 items per slot, this chest can only hold 5 items per slot. This is currently the only way to get rid of wooden tools, since they cannot be dropped. There is a bug that makes ingots fall to the bottom of the chest if the chest is full, even when it is empty. Due to a bug, scroll-clicking on an industrial chest adds the Small Chest to the hotbar, instead of the industrial chest.

title: Industrial_Flower_Picker
content: Industrial Flower Picker Type of block Solid block; Interactable Recipe 5 Red Bronze Ingot 2 Copper Plate 5 Copper Bolt 1 Blue Sticky Gear Crafted with Workbench Tier 4 Best tool Luminous Transparent Description Picks up a type of flower within a radius. The industrial flower picker is an industrial machine used to automatically collect flowers of a certain color and species.  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Industrial Flower Picker 5 Red Bronze Ingot 2 Copper Plate 5 Copper Bolt 1 Blue Sticky Gear Workbench Tier 4  Breaking [ ]  Industrial Flower Picker Breaking Data Hardness 6 Best Tool Pickaxe Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 9 Wooden 18 9 Stone 10 6 Iron 6 4 Gilded Steel 5 3 Diamond 3 2 Opal 3 2 Void Mattock 2  Usage [ ]  Picking flowers [ ]  The industrial flower picker collects flowers within a 6 block radius from the center of the machine if powered with petroleum . It has 2 slots in its user interface—one for the selected flower species and one for fuel. The player can select any color and species of flowers provided that they have at least one in their inventory . Once selected, the machine will begin to pick the selected color and species of flower - fertile or not.  The picked flowers will be outputted onto a conveyor belt on its side and powered with petroleum fuel through the pipe at the other end. The machine will not rewater the parent flowers for them to breed again.  History [ ]  October 9, 2021 Added industrial flower pickers.  Gallery [ ]

title: Industrial_Lumbermill
content: Industrial Lumbermill Type of block Solid block; Interactable Recipe 2 Blue Sticky Gear 3 Steel Rod 1 Conveyor Belt Crafted with Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Best tool Luminous Transparent Description "Chops down trees in front and outputs their drops" The industrial lumbermill is an industrial machine that can be used to cut down trees automatically, but it does NOT re-plant the sapling ; instead, the sapling is outputted with the wood .  Thus, the player has to replant the sapling but the process can be fully automated with help of a sapling automatic planter and filter conveyor .  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Industrial Lumbermill 2 Blue Sticky Gear 3 Steel Rod 1 Conveyor Belt Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4  Breaking [ ]  Industrial Lumbermill Breaking Data Hardness 3 Best Tool Axe Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 5 Wooden 5 9 Stone 3 5 Iron 2 3 Gilded Steel 2 3 Diamond 1 2 Opal 1 2 Void Mattock 1  Usage [ ]  Tree farming [ ]  To use an industrial lumbermill, plant a sapling behind it (see image on right). Then, after the tree is fully grown and the lumbermill is powered with coal or petrified petroleum the tree will get chopped down and its drops will be outputted onto the conveyor output.  History [ ]  April 4, 2021 Added industrial lumbermills. August 15, 2021 Removed the industrial lumbermill's ability to automatically chop down trees.  Trivia [ ]  Even though the July 23, 2021 update introduced the ability to automatically replant saplings when a tree is chopped, the industrial lumbermill still does not replant saplings.

title: Industrial_Merchant_Teleseller
content: Industrial Merchant Teleseller Type of block Solid block; Interactable Recipe 200 Red Bronze Ingot 10 Steel Plate 1 Pink Sticky Gear Crafted with Workbench Tier 4 Best tool Luminous Transparent The industrial merchant teleseller is an industrial machine that automatically sells items to villagers at 90% of the original price without needing to go to the Hub .  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Industrial Merchant Teleseller 200 Red Bronze Ingot 10 Steel Plate 1 Pink Sticky Gear Workbench Tier 4  Breaking [ ]  Industrial Merchant Teleseller Breaking Data Hardness 6 Best Tool None Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 9 Wooden 18 18 Stone 10 10 Iron 6 6 Gilded Steel 5 5 Diamond 3 3 Opal 3 3 Void Mattock 2  Usage [ ]  Shop [ ]  To automatically sell items to villagers , the player must select which villager they would like to sell to and the item they would like to sell. Once selected, the player can input the selected type of item through the conveyor belt at the front, and it will begin to sell the items at a rate of one per second. The coins earned can be withdrawn manually by clicking "Withdraw." The amount earned is 90% of the original profit after rounding.  History [ ]  October 9, 2021 Added industrial merchant telesellers. October 18, 2021 Fixed a bug regarding the industrial merchant teleseller. Increased the tax rate from 10% to 30%. January 8, 2022 Added pineapple stand option. Removed oily crops option. June 25, 2022 Changed the recipe of the industrial merchant teleseller to require 200 red bronze ingots , 10 steel plates , and 1 pink sticky gear instead of 500 red bronze ingots. Decreased tax rate from 30% to 10%. July 30, 2022 Industrial merchant telesellers can now buy normal and large pineapple , cactus , and spinach crates . August 20, 2022 Industrial merchant telesellers can now buy void parasites .  Trivia [ ]  The industrial merchant teleseller is referred to as the "merchant teller seller" in its interface. The villagers in the teleseller are referred to their tag instead of their names. The only villager players are unable to sell items to in the teleseller is Petur due to his prices and offers changing everyday. Prior to January 8, 2022 , the industrial merchant teleseller was the only way to sell oily crops. It is also the only way to sell watermelons and pineapples off-season without turning it into crates .

title: Industrial_Milker
content: Industrial Milker Type of block Solid block; Interactable Recipe 1 Medium Chest 2 Blue Sticky Gear 80 Iron Ingot Crafted with Animal Bench Required skill Level 36 Animal Care Best tool Luminous Transparent Description Fill with buckets to milk cows. An industrial milker is an industrial machine that automates the milking process on cows and yaks .  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Industrial Milker 1 Medium Chest 2 Blue Sticky Gear 80 Iron Ingot Animal Bench Level 36 Animal Care  Breaking [ ]  Industrial Milker Breaking Data Hardness 4.5 Best Tool Pickaxe Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 7 Wooden 14 7 Stone 8 5 Iron 5 3 Gilded Steel 4 3 Diamond 3 2 Opal 2 1 Void Mattock 1  Usage [ ]  Milking [ ]  The industrial milker can be used to automatically milk cows and yaks when ready. It has 2 slots able to hold 12 empty bucket each, and when a cow or yak is ready to be milked, it will automatically go towards the small milk bucket icon near the output conveyor of a nearby industrial milker and get milked, provided that there are empty buckets inside the milker. The milk bucket / yak milk bucket will be outputted through the conveyor belt at the back and the player will receive 11 Animal Care XP (45 with the 4x daily bonus).  History [ ]  January 22, 2021 Added industrial milkers. December 10, 2021 Increased industrial milker's capacity from 3 to 6. Fixed a bug preventing the industrial milker from functioning if 6 buckets are inside it. March 25, 2022 Industrial milkers can now milk yaks . July 30, 2022 Increased the capacity of industrial milkers from 6 to 12. February 17, 2023 Increased number of slots of industrial milkers from 1 to 2.

title: Industrial_Nest
content: Industrial Nest Type of block Solid block; Interactable Recipe 1 Nest 1 Conveyor Belt 3 Blue Sticky Gear Crafted with Animal Bench Required skill Level 45 Animal Care Best tool Luminous Transparent  An industrial nest is an industrial machine that automates the egg collecting process on chickens and ducks . It can also be used to automate the feather collecting process on vultures .  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Industrial Nest 1 Nest 1 Conveyor Belt 3 Blue Sticky Gear Animal Bench Level 45 Animal Care  Breaking [ ]  Industrial Nest Breaking Data Hardness ? Best Tool None Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel ? Wooden ? ? Stone ? ? Iron ? ? Gilded Steel ? ? Diamond ? ? Opal ? ? Void Mattock ?  Usage [ ]  Eggs [ ]  The industrial nest can be used to automatically collect eggs from chickens and ducks when ready. It has 3 slots able to hold 3 eggs each, and when a chicken or duck has laid eggs, it will automatically go towards the industrial nest to collect eggs, provided that its maximum capacity has not yet been reached. The player will receive 15 Animal Care XP (60 with the 4x daily bonus).  History [ ]  March 3, 2023 Added industrial nests.  Trivia [ ]  Like nests , chickens or ducks can also sleep on it.

title: Industrial_Oven
content: Industrial Oven Type of block Solid block; Interactable Recipe 3 Green Sticky Gear 8 Steel Rod Crafted with Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Required skill Level 17 Forging Best tool Luminous Transparent  The industrial oven is an industrial machine used to cook food . Anything that can be cooked, such as dough and berry dough , can be put inside.  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Industrial Oven 8 Steel Rod 3 Green Sticky Gear Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Level 17 Forging  Breaking [ ]  Industrial Oven Breaking Data Hardness 6 Best Tool None Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 9 Wooden 18 18 Stone 10 10 Iron 6 6 Gilded Steel 5 5 Diamond 3 3 Opal 3 3 Void Mattock 2  Usage [ ]  The industrial oven is used to cook food items. It has 6 slots, 3 top ones for food items, and 3 bottom ones for fuel. The oven requires a fuel such as coal as power to cook any food items.  The industrial oven takes 10 seconds to cook an item , and rewards cooking xp once cooked.  Cooking [ ]  Input Output 1 Dough 1 Bread 1 Carrot 1 Roasted Carrot 1 Berry Dough 1 Berry Pie 1 Uncooked Pizza 1 Pizza 1 Carrot Cake Batter 1 Carrot Cake 1 Potato 1 Baked Potato 1 Uncooked Apple Pie 1 Apple Pie 1 Orange Cake Batter 1 Orange Cake 1 Lemon Bread Dough 1 Lemon Bread 1 Uncooked Starfruit Cake 1 Starfruit Cake 1 Uncooked Pineapple Pizza 1 Pineapple Pizza  History [ ]  May 2, 2020 Added industrial ovens. January 8, 2022 Industrial ovens can now cook uncooked pineapple pizzas into cooked pineapple pizzas.  Trivia [ ]  This is widely considered the second easiest industrial item to create, as green slimes are abundant on Slime Island .

title: Industrial_Polishing_Station
content: Industrial Polishing Station Recipe 3 Steel Rod 1 Gearbox 10 Steel Bolt Crafted with Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Required skill Level 24 Forging Best tool Luminous Transparent Description Converts blocks into smooth blocks. The industrial polishing station is an item transformer used to automatically smooth blocks .  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Industrial Polishing Station 3 Steel Rod 1 Gearbox 10 Steel Bolt Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Level 24 Forging  Breaking [ ]  Industrial Polishing Station Breaking Data Hardness 6 Best Tool Pickaxe Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 9 Wooden 18 9 Stone 10 6 Iron 6 4 Gilded Steel 5 3 Diamond 3 2 Opal 3 2 Void Mattock 2  Usage [ ]  Polishing [ ]  Industrial polishing stations can be used to automatically polish certain blocks into their smooth variant when powered with coal or petrified petroleum . It has four slots able to hold one item each in its user interface—three for unprocessed blocks and one for fuel. Unprocessed blocks and fuel can be inputted through the conveyor belt at one side of the industrial stonecutter, powering the machine for 50 seconds per fuel source. It takes 10 seconds to fully polish a block, and once polished, the smooth variant is outputted through the conveyor belt at the other side.  Input Output 1 Aquamarine Block ➡ 1 Smooth Aquamarine 1 Sandstone ➡ 1 Smooth Sandstone 1 Red Sandstone ➡ 1 Smooth Red Sandstone 1 Stone ➡ 1 Smooth Stone 1 Slate ➡ 1 Smooth Slate 1 Marble ➡ 1 Smooth Marble 1 Diorite ➡ 1 Smooth Diorite 1 Andesite ➡ 1 Smooth Andesite 1 Granite ➡ 1 Smooth Granite 1 Basalt ➡ 1 Smooth Basalt  History [ ]  June 4, 2021 Added industrial polishing stations. February 19, 2022 Industrial polishing stations can now polish stone , slate , and marble . March 6, 2022 Industrial polishing stations can now polish andesite , diorite , and granite . April 22, 2022 Fixed a bug causing the crank to fall off when using the industrial polishing station. June 18, 2022 Industrial polishing stations can now polish basalt .

title: Industrial_Sawmill
content: Industrial Sawmill Recipe 8 Steel Rod 3 Blue Sticky Gear Crafted with Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Required skill Level 15 Forging Description Converts wood into wood planks. Industrial sawmills are industrial machines that can be used to automatically turn any wood into its respective plank . It can be used for semi-automatic plank farms, when coupled with an industrial lumbermill .  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Industrial Sawmill 8 Steel Rod 3 Blue Sticky Gear Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Level 15 Forging  Breaking [ ]  Industrial Sawmill Breaking Data Hardness 6 Best Tool None Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 9 Wooden 18 18 Stone 10 10 Iron 6 6 Gilded Steel 5 5 Diamond 3 3 Opal 3 3 Void Mattock 2  Usage [ ]  When powered by coal (one coal will power the machine for about 50 seconds), it will turn any kind of wood into its respective plank type ( e.g. pine wood into pine plank ), via the interface or by dropping them onto a conveyor input of the machine. It takes 15 seconds to fully transform a block .  Transforming [ ]  Input Output ➡ ➡ ➡ ➡ ➡ ➡ ➡  History [ ]  May 2, 2020 Added industrial sawmill. April 1, 2022 Updated the GUI to have one slot for the unheated item, one for the final product, and one for the fuel instead of two for items and one for fuel. 50 items can now queued to be heated in a slot, up from 5. January 20, 2023 Industrial sawmills can now transform cherry blossom wood into cherry blossom planks .  Trivia [ ]  Despite being used to mill wood, it doesn't require any Woodcutting level requirement.

title: Industrial_Smelter
content: Industrial Smelter Type of block Solid Block; Interactable Recipe 8 Steel Rod 1 Pink Sticky Gear Crafted with Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Required skill Level 8 Forging Best tool Luminous Transparent Description Industrial grade ore smelter with conveyor attachments. The industrial smelter is an industrial heating device used to smelt raw ores and clay .  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Industrial Smelter 8 Steel Rod 1 Pink Sticky Gear Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Level 8 Forging  Breaking [ ]  Industrial Smelter Breaking Data Hardness 6 Best Tool Pickaxe Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 9 Wooden 18 9 Stone 10 6 Iron 6 4 Gilded Steel 5 3 Diamond 3 2 Opal 3 2 Void Mattock 2  Usage [ ]  Auto-smelting [ ]  The industrial smelter can be used to automatically smelt items. It has 6 slots able to hold one item each in its user interface — 3 for the raw material and 3 for fuel, both of which can be inputted manually or through the conveyor opening at the back. When powered with coal or petrified petroleum , the industrial smelter will activate for approximately 30 seconds. During this time, it will begin smelting any item inside, taking 10 seconds per item, and will output the smelted item through the conveyor output at the front.  The industrial smelter rewards 4 Forging XP (18 with the 4x daily bonus) for each item smelted.  Input Output 1 Iron Ore 1 Iron Ingot 1 Gold Ore 1 Gold Ingot 1 Copper Ore 1 Copper Ingot 1 Clay 1 Brick  History [ ]  May 2, 2020 Added industrial smelters. May 17, 2020 Industrial smelters can now smelt gold ore . September 18, 2020 Industrial smelters can now smelt copper ore . Changed the industrial smelter's appearance. ? Animated the industrial smelter. ? Changed the particles emitted from the industrial smelter. January 22, 2021 Level 8 Forging is now required to craft industrial smelters. May 20, 2022 1 pink sticky gear is now required to craft industrial smelters, down from 3.  Trivia [ ]  This is the only heating device capable of smelting copper ore . Despite requiring a pink sticky gear since its release, the animated gears on the sides of industrial smelters were not present until the September 18, 2020 update.

title: Industrial_Stonecutter
content: Industrial Stonecutter Type of block Solid block; Interactable Recipe 8 Steel Rod 1 Buffalkor Crystal Crafted with Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Required skill Level 22 Forging Best tool Luminous Transparent The industrial stonecutter is an industrial machine that can automatically cut blocks into their brick, tiled, or carved variant.  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Industrial Stonecutter 8 Steel Rod 1 Buffalkor Crystal Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Level 22 Forging  Breaking [ ]  Industrial Stonecutter Breaking Data Hardness 6 Best Tool Pickaxe Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 9 Wooden 18 9 Stone 10 6 Iron 6 4 Gilded Steel 5 3 Diamond 3 2 Opal 3 2 Void Mattock 2  Usage [ ]  Transforming [ ]  Industrial stonecutters can be used to automatically cut certain blocks into their brick, tiled, or carved variant when powered with coal or petrified petroleum . It has two slots able to hold one item each in its user interface—one for an unprocessed block and one for fuel. Unprocessed blocks and fuel can be inputted through the conveyor belt at one side of the industrial stonecutter, powering the machine for 50 seconds per fuel source. It takes 16 seconds to fully cut a block, and once cut, the block variant is outputted through the conveyor belt at the other side. December 18, 2021 Industrial stonecutters can now cut compact ice . title: Industrial_Truffle_Barrel

Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Industrial Truffle Barrel 1 Truffle Barrel 1 Conveyor Belt 3 Blue Sticky Gear Animal Bench Level 48 Animal Care  Breaking [ ]  Industrial Truffle Barrel Breaking Data Hardness 2 Best Tool None Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 3 Wooden 6 6 Stone 4 4 Iron 2 2 Gilded Steel 2 2 Diamond 1 1 Opal 1 1 Void Mattock 1  Usage [ ]  Truffle [ ]  The industrial truffle barrel can be used to automatically collect truffles from pigs when ready. title: Industrial_Washing_Station
content: Industrial Washing Station Type of block Solid block; Interactable Recipe 1 Propeller 3 Blue Sticky Gear 10 Steel Rod Crafted with Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Best tool Luminous Transparent Description Cleans oily crops. The industrial washing station is an industrial item transformer used to wash oily crops .  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Industrial Washing Station 1 Propeller 3 Blue Sticky Gear 10 Steel Rod Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Level 27 Forging  Breaking [ ]  Industrial Washing Station Breaking Data Hardness 6 Best Tool Pickaxe Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 9 Wooden 18 9 Stone 10 6 Iron 6 4 Gilded Steel 5 3 Diamond 3 2 Opal 3 2 Void Mattock 2  Usage [ ]  Auto-washing crops [ ]  Industrial washing stations can be used to automatically wash oily crops into their respective clean crop variant. Oily crops and fuel can be inputted through the conveyor belt opening at the front. It has six slots able to hold one item each in its user interface—three for oily crops and three for fuel. When powered with coal or petrified petroleum , the industrial washing station will activate for approximately 20 seconds. During this time, it will begin washing any oily crops inside, taking 1.5 seconds per crop.  Once done, the washed crops will be outputted through the conveyor belt at the other side of the machine. June 16, 2020 Industrial washing stations now wash crops in 1.5 seconds, down from 5 seconds. January 22, 2021 Level 27 Forging is now required to craft industrial washing stations. ? Changed the color of the conveyor lines from white to gray.  Trivia [ ]  This is the only industrial machine that does not have smoke particles coming out when fueled as it has tiny water and bubble particles instead. The industrial washing station's conveyor lines used to be white instead of gray. The industrial washing station does not wash faster than the manual washing station ; it washes slightly slower.

title: Infernal_Dragon
content: Infernal Dragon Health 13,000 HP Behavior Hostile Attack strength 25 - 50 ( Headbutt ) 75 ( Lava Wave ) 40 DPS, 400 total ( Fire Breath) Drops Infernal Dragon Egg Jukebox Disk Location Underworld The Infernal Dragon is a boss that was added in the September 11, 2021 update. It has 13,000 health and can be summoned in the Underworld for at least 750 Underworld Tokens . It has no summon cooldown.  Description [ ]  The Infernal Dragon can be summoned at the bottom of the stairway to its arena in the Underworld for at least 750 Underworld tokens .  Like other bosses , if there are no players in the arena, if the player is idle for too long, or if the battle takes more than 10 minutes, the Infernal Dragon will despawn and the player will have to respawn it with at least 750 more Underworld tokens.  Attacks [ ]  The Infernal Dragon has four different types of attacks that are executed in a specific order with a few random attacks executed sporadically. When summoned, it will start with a fire breath attack towards the nearest player, following up with a headbutt. Afterward, it will summon lava waves and end the cycle by summoning magma blobs before repeating from the beginning.  The dragon will fly into the air and go to a random edge of the summoning area whenever its lava wave or fire breath attacks are finished.  Lava Wave [ ]  The Infernal Dragon summons 6 waves of lava originating under its abdomen and sweeping outwards, spanning the entire arena lengthwise and dealing 75 HP of damage if hit. Each lava wave has gaps within them and a 10 - 20 stud gap between the following wave, allowing the player to safely pass through without taking damage. Once the attack has been finished, the dragon will fly to a random edge of the platform.  Fire Breath [ ]  The Infernal Dragon turns towards the targeted player and breathes a stream of fire for 10 seconds that deals 40 damage per second, dealing a maximum of 400 damage if the player does not move out of the way. The dragon will constantly reposition when executing this attack and will fly to a random edge of the platform after the attack has been finished.  Headbutt [ ]  The Infernal Dragon targets a random player and moves forward to hit them with its head, knocking them back and dealing between 25 and 50 damage if hit. The headbutt can pierce, which damages multiple players at a time.  Summon [ ]  The Infernal Dragon summons between 1 and 7 magma blobs ; the number summoned varies in proportion to the number of players currently fighting the dragon.  Drops [ ]  The Infernal Dragon rewards 1251 XP (4998 with the 4x daily bonus or 126 when maxed out) Combat XP and 1251 XP (4998 with the 4x daily bonus or 126 when maxed out) Light Melee , Heavy Melee , Magic , or Archery XP depending on the weapon the player used to defeat it.  With the XP Boost , the Infernal Dragon rewards 1437 XP (5748 with the 4x daily bonus or 144 when maxed out) Combat XP and 1437 XP (5748 with the 4x daily bonus or 144 when maxed out) Light Melee , Heavy Melee , Magic , or Archery XP depending on the weapon the player used to defeat it.  Image Name Drop chance Infernal Dragon Egg 100% Jukebox Disks Red Jukebox Disk 0.35% Yellow Jukebox Disk 0.35% Blue Jukebox Disk 0.35% Green Jukebox Disk 0.01% Purple Jukebox Disk 0.01% Orange Jukebox Disk 0.01%  Damage reduction [ ]  The Infernal Dragon reduces the amount of damage dealt to it by 10% to 55% depending on the number of players (compounds) in the arena.  Number of players Damage reduction 1 0% 2 10% 3 25% 4 35% 5 45% 6+ 55%  Resistances and weaknesses [ ]  Resistances Weaknesses Physical Magical Physical Magical Striking Void , Inferno Piercing Ethereal , Hydro  Bugs and glitches [ ]  If too many players constantly hit the Infernal Dragon in one direction with magic attacks, it may fall off its platform and despawn, dropping no loot or refund. The dragon may repeatedly glitch into its idle or flying animations if it is attacked enough times. The dragon may be stuck in its idle animation if it is at low health, unable to attack or move.  History [ ]  September 11, 2021 Added the Infernal Dragon. Buffed the Infernal Dragon to have more health and deal more damage. September 12, 2021 The Infernal Dragon now requires 750 Underworld tokens instead of 500 to summon. Fixed a bug causing the Infernal Dragon to return to its idle animation if attacked too often. The Infernal Dragon can no longer summon bandits to aid it in battle. May 14, 2022 Fixed a bug preventing the Infernal Dragon from spawning and not showing its spawn cost. August 13, 2022 Lowered the Infernal Dragon's health from 30,000 HP to 17,000 HP. May 16, 2023 Lowered the Infernal Dragon's health from 17,000 HP to 13,000 HP.  Trivia [ ]  This is one of the only seven bosses capable of summoning mobs , the other 6 being the Slime Queen , Bhaa , Percival the Pumpkin King , Void Serpent , the Grand High Witch , and Zombie Cletus . The Infernal Dragon is the first boss in Islands that don't have a summon cooldown. It is the first boss in Islands that require its own token to be summoned. The Infernal Dragon has the third-most health of any mob in the game, the second being Percival the Pumpkin King with 20,000 HP, and the first being the Void Serpent with 50,000 HP. The dragon itself has a very large hitbox; it can even be hit while it is flying. This mob has a special soundtrack when battling it. It can be heard here . The Infernal Dragon rewards and shares the same amount of XP as the Wizard Boss , Bhaa, Percival the Pumpkin King, and Fhanhorn . The Infernal Dragon has the least number of non- jukebox disk drops of all mobs in the game, having only one.

title: Infernal_Dragon_Egg
content: Infernal Dragon Egg Unopened Opened Type of block Solid block; Interactable Dropped by Infernal Dragon Best tool Luminous Transparent Description A reward from killing the Infernal Dragon! The infernal dragon egg is a roulette block that can be obtained by defeating the Infernal Dragon .  Obtaining [ ]  Mob drop [ ]  The Infernal Dragon is guaranteed to drop one infernal dragon egg upon defeat. However, if too many players are fighting the dragon, only a set amount of players will receive an egg.  Loot [ ]  Infernal dragon eggs can be opened by holding "F" on PC, holding the button on mobile, or holding X on Xbox while hovering over it. Once opened, the infernal dragon egg will scroll through the items like a roulette wheel and reward one item, similar to treasure chests and cauldrons.  The listed reward chances are community made and may not be accurate .  Item Rarity Estimated % chance Dragon Pet Spawn Egg Mythic 0.5% Opal Sword Hilt Mythic 3.5% Infernal Flame Rare 9% Opal Pickaxe Hilt Rare 9% Opal Axe Hilt Rare 9% 25 - 100 Infernal Fish Common 23% 300 - 1,000 Underworld Token Common 23% 10 - 50 Opal Common 23%  Note: Once opened, infernal dragon eggs will NOT be returned to the player's inventory . After collecting the rewarded item, the egg will act as a storage block with a single slot able to hold 100 items.  History [ ]  September 11, 2021 Added infernal dragon eggs. December 10, 2021 Fixed a bug that caused opened infernal dragon eggs to constantly play the sound effect of being presented with an item from an infernal dragon egg. December 29, 2021 Disabled manually placing items into infernal dragon eggs. January 2, 2022 Re-enabled the ability to manually place items into infernal dragon eggs. January 3, 2022 Disabled the ability to manually place items into infernal dragon eggs. Re-enabled the ability to manually place items into infernal dragon eggs. January 4, 2022 Disabled the ability to manually place items into infernal dragon eggs. January 6, 2022 Re-enabled the ability to manually place items into infernal dragon eggs. April 16, 2022 Infernal dragon eggs may now reward infernal flames . October 22, 2022 Unopened infernal dragon eggs now have a present icon next to it.  Trivia [ ]  There is currently a bug where players may be unable to collect underworld tokens rewarded by an infernal dragon egg. This can be fixed by mining the egg or the block under the egg, which will automatically drop the rewarded item into the player's inventory once broken.

title: Infernal_Flame
content: Infernal Flame Description A single yet rare flame from the infernal dragon. The infernal flame is an item that has a chance to be obtained from infernal dragon eggs .  Obtaining [ ]  Dragon eggs [ ]  Opening an infernal dragon egg has a 9% chance of rewarding an infernal flame, having a rarity of 'rare'.  Usage [ ]  Crafting ingredient [ ]  Image Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Infernal Dragon Orb 10 Glass Block 20 Red Bronze Ingot 1 Infernal Flame Workbench Tier 4 Level 55 Combat Defeated the Infernal Dragon at least once Infernal Hammer 1 Infernal Flame 200 Magma Block 5 Gilded Steel Rod 50 Steel Plate Anvil Level 55 Heavy Melee  History [ ]  April 16, 2022 Added infernal flames. April 22, 2022 Infernal flames can now be used to craft infernal hammers .  Trivia [ ]  Contrary to its description, the infernal flame is not directly dropped by the Infernal Dragon .

title: Infernal_Hammer
content: Infernal Hammer Type Heavy Melee Physical class Striking Magical class Inferno Attack damage 48 HP (Base) 72 HP (Critical) Recipe 1 Infernal Flame 200 Magma Block 5 Gilded Steel Rod 50 Steel Plate Crafted with Anvil Required skill Level 55 Heavy Melee Description Magical hammer forged from depths of the underworld. The infernal hammer is a heavy melee weapon in the striking and inferno classes.  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Infernal Hammer 1 Infernal Flame 200 Magma Block 5 Gilded Steel Rod 50 Steel Plate Anvil Level 55 Heavy Melee  Attacking [ ]  At level 1 Heavy Melee , the infernal hammer deals a base damage of 48 HP and can be swung every 0.5 seconds. It has the ability to damage multiple mobs in one swing. There's also a small chance of landing a critical hit when using this weapon, meaning the attack will deal an extra 24 HP of damage and its damage can be increased by leveling up the Heavy Melee skill and it is in the striking and inferno classes.  Like other melee weapon , only one player can hit damage in each hostile mob. Multiple players cannot hit damage together.  History [ ]  April 22, 2022 Added infernal hammers. September 17, 2022 Infernal hammers are now a striking and inferno weapon. October 8, 2022 Infernal hammers will now burn an attacked hostile mob whenever an attack successfully hits the mob.  Trivia [ ]  The infernal hammer is one of the only weapons with a physical and magical classification, with the others being the frost hammer , the frost sword , the trout's fury , the serpent's hook , the reaper's scythe , jolly dagger , and the noxious stinger . If the mob has a weakness or resistance to both of its classification, then the damage multiplier will be either higher or lower than normal. If the mob has a weakness and resistance to both classifications, then neutral damage will apply.

title: Info_Booklet
content: Info booklets are a feature in Islands that allows players to learn about the game's aspects and mechanics. It was added in the May 21, 2021 update. It can be viewed by selecting the button on the left UI sidebar.  Booklets [ ]  There are currently only 6 tutorials in the info booklet UI. Though many more are expected in future updates .  Categories [ ]  There are currently 11 categories in the info booklet menu:  History [ ]  May 21, 2021 Added the info booklet menu (6 booklets). August 28, 2021 The info booklet menu button is changed. June 10, 2022 Added more info booklets.  Trivia [ ]  It is possible for a tutorial to be in more than one category. An example is "Crop Totems", which is in both the Farming and Factory categories. The "Breed Flowers" and "Fertile Flowers" tutorials have the same icon.

title: Ingot_(disambiguation)
content: Ingot may refer to:  Iron Ingot Gold Ingot Copper Ingot Steel Ingot Red Bronze Ingot

title: Instrument
content: Instruments are items that are crafted in the instrument workbench and can be used to play various different tunes. There are currently 6 different instruments in the game, with two being free to play without the instrument workbench gamepass and 4 requiring the gamepass to play, even if a non-gamepass owner owns one through trading .  All instruments play a fixed tune, meaning that players are unable to play or compose pieces other than the default one.  Instruments [ ]  Free [ ]  There are currently two free instruments that doesn't require the player to own the instrument workbench gamepass to play. However, the player is unable to craft duplicates of these instruments due to being unable to craft in the instrument workbench .  Premium [ ]  There are currently four premium instruments that require the player to own the instrument workbench gamepass to play. Any player who owns these instruments yet don't own the gamepass is unable to play them.  Instrument Audio Artist Bongo Drum https://robloxislands.fandom.com/wiki/File:Bongo_Drum.ogg Micah Fischer Guitar https://robloxislands.fandom.com/wiki/File:Guitar.ogg Micah Fischer Kalimba https://robloxislands.fandom.com/wiki/File:Kalimba.ogg Micah Fischer Melodica https://robloxislands.fandom.com/wiki/File:Melodica.ogg Micah Fischer Pan Flute https://robloxislands.fandom.com/wiki/File:Pan_Flute.ogg Micah Fischer Tambourine https://robloxislands.fandom.com/wiki/File:Tambourine.ogg Micah Fischer All https://robloxislands.fandom.com/wiki/File:Ode_to_Mitsuda.mp3 Micah Fischer

title: Instrument_Workbench
content: Instrument Workbench Block Gamepass Type of block Solid block; Crafting Recipe 20 Oak Wood Crafted with Workbench Tier 1 Workbench Tier 2 Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Buy cost (gamepass) 499 Robux Best tool Luminous Transparent Description Craft instruments. The instrument workbench is a premium crafting station that is used to craft instruments .  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  The player needs the instrument workbench gamepass to craft the instrument workbench.  Name Recipe Crafting station Gamepass required Instrument Workbench 20 Oak Wood Workbench Tier 1 Workbench Tier 2 Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4  Breaking [ ]  Instrument Workbench Breaking Data Hardness 6 Best Tool None Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 9 Wooden 18 18 Stone 10 10 Iron 6 6 Gilded Steel 5 5 Diamond 3 3 Opal 3 3 Void Mattock 2  Usage [ ]  Crafting recipes [ ]  Image Name Recipe Bongo Drum 10 Iron Ingot 10 Oak Wood Guitar 10 Iron Ingot 10 Oak Wood Kalimba 10 Iron Ingot 10 Oak Wood Melodica 10 Iron Ingot 10 Oak Wood Pan Flute 10 Iron Ingot 10 Oak Wood Tambourine 10 Iron Ingot 10 Oak Wood  History [ ]  July 9, 2021 Added instrument workbenches. title: Inventory
content: The inventory allows players to access all their unplaced possessions. The maximum space in the inventory is unknown, and possibly infinite, as no player has reached it.  Accessing [ ]  To open the inventory, click on the backpack icon at the right side of the hotbar . PC players can tap the "E" key to open/close the inventory. Clicking outside of the inventory box will close it. Selecting an item will send it to an empty slot in the player's hotbar. Empty slots have a centered circle as a place-marker. If the hotbar is full, then players must swap out items to make space. Desktop players can hover their mouse to show an item's name.  Features [ ]  Sorting [ ]  A player's inventory can be sorted into six categories.  Button Holds All items Any item that can be placed on a Player's Island Seeds , Crops , Fish , Bait , Fertilizer , Leaves , and Potions Food Pickaxes , Axes , Weapons , and Farming Tools Miscellaneous (includes Mob Drops , Pearls , Propellers , Blueprints and minerals)  Search Bar [ ]  The search bar is located at the top right of the inventory UI. It allows players to find a specific item with a keyword.  Season Indicator [ ]  The current season in-game is stated above the search bar. Fall Winter Spring Summer  Wallet [ ]  A player's coin amount is shown at the top left of the inventory UI. Any coins deposited into vending machines will not be counted here.  History [ ]  April 24, 2020 The original inventory UI was black and gray. August 30, 2020 Search and sorting features are added. The inventory was redesigned with a tan color scheme. August 30, 2020 The amount of Coins a player has is now displayed above the sorting tabs. February 12, 2021 The "Backpack" icon was added. March 13, 2021 Added an indicator for the current season . August 28, 2021 The button to access the inventory was moved to the right of the hotbar . This update also refreshed the sorting buttons. April 1, 2022 Added food category. June 25, 2022 Seasons now have icons next to them. August 27, 2022 Differentiated all seeds in the inventory. October 15, 2022 Changed the icon for the inventory button.  Trivia [ ]  Using the /reset command no longer erases a player's inventory. Nowadays, typing /reset in the chat only gets rid of all the blocks placed on the Player's Island and replaces it with a current version of the starter island.

title: Iridescent_Flower
content: The Iridescent Flower is an item obtainable from the Cauldron (2023)  It's description reads:  "A forever living flower"  It is also an item in the Haunted Mansion Event where you have to mine rocks with a pickaxe to obtain to fight the Cursed Wraith.  It can be obtained by opening a Cauldron (2023) which you get from killing The Cursed Wraith .

title: Iron_Door
content: Iron Door Type of block Solid block; Interactable Recipe 30 Iron Ingot 1 Green Sticky Gear Crafted with Workbench Tier 2 Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Best tool Luminous Transparent An iron door is a block that can only be opened by the owner of the player island it is placed on or by a player who has build permissions on that island.  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Iron Door 30 Iron Ingot 1 Green Sticky Gear Workbench Tier 2 Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4  Breaking [ ]  Iron Door Breaking Data Hardness 6 Best Tool None Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 9 Wooden 18 18 Stone 10 10 Iron 6 6 Gilded Steel 5 5 Diamond 3 3 Opal 3 3 Void Mattock 2  Usage [ ]  Opening [ ]  Iron doors can only be opened by the owner of the player island it is placed on, or by other players with build permission on that island. There is a glitch where if you open the door, only one direction of the stripes will stay instead of both

title: Iron_Fishing_Rod
content: Iron Fishing Rod Recipe 50 Maple Wood 40 Iron Ingot Crafted with Workbench Tier 2 Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Required skill Level 20 Fishing The iron fishing rod is a tool used for fishing unlocked at level 20 Fishing . It was added in the February 26, 2021 update and is an upgraded version of the wooden fishing rod . It cannot be dropped.  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Iron Fishing Rod 50 Maple Wood 40 Iron Ingot Workbench Tier 2 Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4 Level 20 Fishing  Usage [ ]  Fishing [ ]  Fishing rods can be cast into bodies of water . After a short period of time, a fish shadow will approach the bobber and “bite” it. A UI will appear above the player's hotbar where they must keep a red block within a certain area until the yellow progress bar reaches the end. If the player fails to fill the bar within 25 seconds, the fish will disappear and the rod will reel itself in. The iron fishing rod can only be used if the player is level 20 Fishing .  History [ ]  February 26, 2021 Added iron fishing rods. April 1, 2022 Fixed a bug that prevented players from reeling back the iron fishing rod.  Trivia [ ]  Before the iron fishing rod was added, the wooden fishing rod could catch any fish and treasure. Now, the wooden fishing rod can only catch lower tiers of fish.

Workbench None  Steel-making [ ]  Iron ingots can be turned into steel ingots in a steel mill or blast furnace . Both require coal or petrified petroleum as a fuel source to start processing.  Input Item transformer Output 1 Iron Ingot ➡ Steel Mill ➡ 1 Steel Ingot ➡ Blast Furnace ➡  Selling [ ]  Iron ingots can be sold to Jade for 6 coins each.  History [ ]  April 10, 2020 Added iron. March 12, 2022 Iron can now be used to craft castle shields , horse shields , king's shields , medieval chandeliers , medieval green couches , and plated wall torches . April 9, 2022 Iron can now be used to craft teleporter pads , Hub Island orbs , and orb stands . May 20, 2022 Iron can now be used to craft blast furnaces . June 18, 2022 Iron can now be sold to Jade instead of to John . June 25, 2022 Iron can now be used to craft ruby swords . July 2, 2022 Iron can now be used to craft trash cans . July 30, 2022 Renamed iron to "Iron Ingot". Changed the description from "Smelted from iron ore." to "An ingot of iron, smelted from iron ore." August 13, 2022 Iron ingots can now be used to craft serpent's hooks and serpent's banes . September 10, 2022 Iron ingots can now be used to craft silver butterfly lanterns and green butterfly lanterns . September 17, 2022 Iron ingots can now be used to craft iron shortbows . October 15, 2022 Iron ingots can now be used to craft granite hammers . October 28, 2022 Iron ingots can now be used to craft lounge chairs , table tops , table top chairs , hanging guitars , short table tops , and speaker systems . December 2, 2022 Iron ingots can now be used to craft lockers , lunch tables , lunch benches , school chairs , school desks , desks & chairs , school bells , blackboards , whiteboards , and school water fountains . January 6, 2023 Iron ingots can now be used to craft diner tables , diner booths , counter corners , counter centers , and neon light diner signs .  Trivia [ ]  Iron ingots were originally used to craft steel rods , but has been replaced by steel ingots after the September 18, 2020 update. Iron ingots were originally sold to John instead of Jade . With more than 130, iron ingots are included in the most crafting recipes.

title: Iron_Long_Arrow
content: Iron Long Arrow Type Large arrow Physical class Piercing Attack damage 15 - 20 HP 26 - 34 HP (Fully charged) Recipe 4 Maple Wood 2 Iron Ingot Crafted with Anvil Required skill Level 25 Archery Description A more sturdy arrow that can be shot from longbows Iron long arrows are large arrows that can be shot from longbows .  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill 2 Iron Long Arrow 4 Maple Wood 2 Iron Ingot Anvil Level 25 Archery  Usage [ ]  Ammunition [ ]  Iron long arrows are used as ammunition in longbows , as at least one is required to be in the player's inventory in order for the bow to fire. Shooting an iron long arrow deals an extra 15 - 20 HP to mobs .  Iron long arrows are a one-time use item , meaning they cannot be retrieved after they have been shot.  History [ ]  September 24, 2022 Added iron long arrows. ? Changed the recipe from 6 maple wood and 4 iron ingot to 4 maple wood and 2 iron ingot.  Trivia [ ]  Unlike stone short arrows , the limit of iron long arrows is 2,000 instead of 20,000.

title: Iron_Ore
content: Iron Ore Iron Ore Rock Dropped by Buffalkor Spawns Hub Slime Island Buffalkor Island Diamond Mines Description Heat up to smelt into iron. Found in the Hub. Iron ore is an ore that can be mined from iron rocks.  Obtaining [ ]  Mining [ ]  Iron rocks naturally generate in the mining zone in the Hub , Emerald Mines ， Slime Island , Buffalkor Island , and the Diamond Mines . Mining an iron rock yields 1 - 2 iron ore per stage, resulting in a total of 2 - 4 iron ore. There's also a 1.5% chance that the rock drops crystallized iron .  Totems [ ]  Iron totems can be purchased from Arius at the Hub for 4,000 coins after reaching level 18 in the Mining skill. An iron totem will spawn iron rocks around it when placed, or if placed next to a conveyor belt , the totem will drop iron ore directly onto the conveyor.  The test totem has the same function as an iron totem but has a different appearance and cannot be purchased from the Arius. The rocks spawned by the test totem used to have a higher chance to drop crystallized iron but was made equal to the regular iron totem around May 10, 2020 .  Mob drop [ ]  Buffalkors are guaranteed to drop 1 iron ore upon defeat and a 50% chance of dropping 2.  Breaking [ ]  Iron Rock Breaking Data Hardness 20 Best Tool Pickaxe Max Hits Needed Material/Tool Axe Pickaxe Stone Shovel 30 Wooden 60 30 Stone 32 20 Iron 20 13 Gilded Steel 14 10 Diamond 10 6 Opal 8 4 Void Mattock 4  Usage [ ]  Crafting ingredient [ ]  Image Name Recipe Crafting station Workbench Tier 1 5 Oak Wood 2 Iron Ore Workbench Workbench Tier 1 Workbench Tier 2 Workbench Tier 3 Workbench Tier 4  Smelting [ ]  Smelting iron ore in a campfire , small furnace , desert furnace , or industrial smelter will turn it into iron ingots .  Input Output 1 Iron Ore 1 Iron Ingot  Trivia [ ]  Prior the March 5, 2021 update, an iron rock will spawn on the player's island upon island creation.

title: Iron_Shortbow
content: Iron Shortbow Type Shortbow Attack damage 18 HP 31 HP (Fully charged) 26 - 29 HP ( Stone Short Arrow ) 45 - 50 HP (Stone Short Arrow; Fully charged) 31 - 36 HP ( Iron Short Arrow ) 43 - 62 HP (Iron Short Arrow; Fully charged) 36 - 42 HP ( Steel Short Arrow ) 62 - 72 HP (Steel Short Arrow; Fully charged) Recipe 30 Maple Wood 30 Iron Ingot 2 Ancient Slime String Crafted with Anvil Required skill Level 10 Archery Description A more study [sic] shortbow The iron shortbow is a ranged weapon that shoots small arrows .  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill Iron Shortbow 30 Maple Wood 30 Iron Ingot 2 Ancient Slime String Anvil Level 10 Archery  Attacking [ ]  To shoot the bow, at least one small arrow must be in the player's inventory . The bow can be charged by holding left click on PC or holding down on mobile and the damage dealt by the arrow will increase in proportion to the time the bow is charged.  At level 1 Archery , the iron shortbow deals a base damage of 18 HP to mobs , and its damage can be increased by leveling up the Archery skill.  Charging [ ]  Charging a shot will increase the amount of damage dealt by 1.7x at full charge. This additional damage can be increased by leveling up the Archery skill.  History [ ]  August 9, 2020 Added "Bow 4". September 17, 2022 Renamed "Bow 4" to "Iron Shortbow". Iron shortbows can now be crafted in the anvil .

title: Iron_Short_Arrow
content: Iron Short Arrow Type Small arrow Physical class Piercing Attack damage 13 - 18 HP 22 - 31 HP (Fully charged) Recipe 2 Maple Wood 1 Iron Ingot Crafted with Anvil Required skill Level 20 Archery Description A sturdy arrow that can be fired from shortbows Iron short arrows are small arrows that can be shot from shortbows .  Obtaining [ ]  Crafting [ ]  Name Recipe Crafting station Required skill 2 Iron Short Arrow 2 Maple Wood 1 Iron Ingot Anvil Level 20 Archery  Usage [ ]  Ammunition [ ]  Iron short arrows are used as ammunition in shortbows , as at least one is required to be in the player's inventory in order for the shortbow to fire. Shooting an iron short arrow deals an extra 13 - 18 HP to mobs .  Iron short arrows are a one-time use item , meaning they cannot be retrieved after they have been shot.  History [ ]  September 24, 2022 Added iron short arrows. ? Changed the recipe from 4 maple wood and 3 iron ingot to 2 maple wood and 1 iron ingot.  Trivia [ ]  Unlike stone short arrows , the limit of iron short arrows is 2,000 instead of 20,000.

title: Iron_Skorp
content: Iron Skorp Health 500 HP Behavior Hostile Attack strength 35 HP Effect Food Poison Drops Iron Skorp Scale Desert Portal Shard Jukebox Disk Bhaa Token Location Desert Island The iron skorp is a hostile mob that spawns on the Desert Island along with the gold skorp and ruby skorp .  Spawning [ ]  Naturally [ ]  The iron skorp spawns on the Desert Island and is the most common type of skorp to spawn with a 75% chance.  Bhaa [ ]  Bhaa can summon iron skorps to help him in battle.  Behavior [ ]  The iron skorp deals 35 HP in damage to the player. Like all other skorps, the player also receives the Food Poison effect, which stops the player from consuming food for a certain amount of time. A regen potion can still be used to regenerate a player's health during fights with the ruby skorp, and vamp bows and ruby staffs can still heal the player. It gives 75 combat XP or 300 combat XP with the Daily Bonus.  Drops [ ]  Icon Item Drop chance Iron Skorp Scale 150% Desert Portal Shard 0.02% Bhaa Token 500% Jukebox Disk drops Red Jukebox Disk 0.35% Yellow Jukebox Disk 0.35% Blue Jukebox Disk 0.35% Green Jukebox Disk 0.01% Orange Jukebox Disk 0.01% Purple Jukebox Disk 0.01%  Resistances and Weaknesses [ ]  Resistances Weaknesses Physical Magical Physical Magical None Storm Slashing Quake  Trivia [ ]  This mob used to be 1 of 4 mobs that had a chance of dropping a blueprint prior to September 17, 2022 . This mob is the weakest, and most common of the 3 skorp variants. This is the only skorp variant that does not have its own claw variant.

title: Iron_Sword
content: Iron Sword Type Light Melee Physical class Slashing Attack damage 22 HP (Base) +11 HP (Critical) Recipe 40 Iron Ingot 10 Oak Wood Crafted with Anvil The iron sword is a light melee weapon in the slashing class. It has the ability to damage multiple mobs in one swing. There's also a small chance of landing a critical hit when using this weapon, meaning the attack will deal an extra 11 HP of damage. title: Islands_Discontinuation
content: Islands Discontinuation The thumbnail which has been used since. Basic Information Day released November 7, 2023 Version Navigator Previous version November 7, 2023 Islands was announced to be discontinued on November 7, 2023, at 1:44 AM PDT in the official Discord server.  Reasons [ ]  Although the developers at Easy.gg have not released an official statement containing the reasons that Islands is being discontinued, members of the community have speculated that it is due to these factors:  Low player counts relative to the work done by developers BedWars is far more popular and they decided to move all their devs into BedWars rather than update Islands Game riddled with scammers, exploiters, and dupers ruining the economy Unoptimized, old and difficult code  Gallery [ ]  Trivia [ ]  Since the discontinuation, there has been one bug fix update on September 24, 2024, which was likely to add a maturity rating for the game, which the game was classified as “Minimal”. The thumbnail used  was almost the same thumbnail used in the Electricity update at December 11th, 2020 .

title: Item
content: An item is an object that exists only within the player's inventory and hotbar.  Behavior [ ]  When used, some items place a block version of themselves into the game. For example, water buckets turn into a fluid when placed, and seeds turn into a plant block when placed. When selected in the hotbar , items briefly display their names above the UI.  Some items can be displayed in the game environment by placing into a tool stand .  If an item is dropped, it will lay on the ground until a player picks it up, the island owner leaves the game, it is despawned due to the dropped item limit, it is picked up by an industrial chest or an industrial machine , or it is destroyed or disappeared in the void.  List of items [ ]  Items that create blocks, fluids or entities [ ]  Items with use in the game [ ]  These items, when highlighted in a player's hotbar (a.k.a "held"), can be used by either attack or use, or can serve a specific purpose (for example, offer the player an advantage or disadvantage). Some can be used at any time, while others only when aiming at specific blocks or mobs .  Items with indirect use in the game [ ]  The player cannot interact with or directly use these items; however, some can be sold or used in crafting recipes for other items that do have direct uses.  Removed items [ ]  These items have at one point in time been obtainable, but has since been removed from players' inventories, vending machines, and chests. Despite this, they may still exist in some players' inventories.  Unimplemented items [ ]  These items exist in the game's files but have been left unused or unimplemented due to various reasons.

title: Item_Port
content: The item port is a block used to hold an item . It cannot be obtained through normal gameplay.  Obtaining [ ]  Starter Island [ ]  An item port spawns on the starter island holding the plow . The block cannot be seen or broken.  Chicken Eggs [ ]  An item port spawns on the block where a chicken lays its egg . The block also cannot be seen or broken.  Duck Eggs [ ]  An item port spawns on the block where a duck lays a duck egg . The block also cannot be seen or broken.  Animal Spawn Eggs [ ]  An item port also spawns when an animal lays an egg.  Usage [ ]  The purpose of the item port is to be able to have an item on an island without it ever de-spawning like a dropped item would.  Trivia [ ]  Item ports may be found on display in vending machines , most likely through the use of exploits or glitches.

title: Ivon
content: Ivon Location Hub , Slime Island Purpose Buys certain items found on mob islands. Occupation Adventurer Ivon is a villager located in the Hub next to the portal to Slime Island . Players can exchange various items found on mob islands for coins .  Shop [ ]  Ivon buys certain items found on mob islands. He also sells a variety of arrows.  Buying [ ]  Image Name Sell price Acorn 2 coins Horseradish 2 coins Green Slime Ball 5 coins Blue Slime Ball 35 coins Pink Slime Ball 125 coins Empty Potion Bottle 20 coins Iron Skorp Scale 75 coins Gold Skorp Scale 250 coins Ruby Skorp Scale 1,000 coins  Selling [ ]  Image Name Sell price Stone Short Arrow 100 coins Iron Short Arrow 150 coins Steel Short Arrow 200 coins Stone Long Arrow 150 coins Iron Long Arrow 250 coins Steel Long Arrow 350 coins Long Crossbow Bolt 1,000 coins  Dialogue [ ]  In the February 26, 2021 update, Ivon received a new NPC UI.  Current [ ]  "What brings ya here user ?" >View Shop Opens shop. >Ask about scepter "Those pink lights turned out to be this massive pink slime! A queen! She was mighty tough but I finally beat her! She dropped some Pink Slime Crystals and I made a scepter out of 'em! You could make one too!" >Hmm End.  During Godzilla vs. Kong Event [ ]  "The titans are near! What brings ya here user ?" >View Shop Opens shop.  On Fishing Festival Island [ ]  Ivon would say one of the two lines below:  "Real fishing is done with spearguns." >Okay End.  "Fishing is fun until the fish are stronger than you." >Okay End.  On Farming Festival Island [ ]  Ivon would say one of the two lines below:  "This farm may look peaceful, but I assure you there could be foes lurking in any corner!" >Sure... End.  "Cletus brought me here to keep this farm free of slimes!"  >Why? "Don't you know!? Nothing worse than sticky wheat!" >Yeah... End.  At Slime Dungeon ( Slime Island ) [ ]  Upon clicking the option on his avatar to "Talk", he following general dialogues appear:  "Who do you think will win the fight between me and the Primordial Slime?" "I bet I could take the Primordial Slime in a one-on-one fight!" "Have you heard of the Primordial Slime? He seems like a big, scary guy!" "Not that I am scared but the Primordial Slime seems like a big, scary dude!" "Hi there! Just a warning, the last humans I saw enter the dungeons, never made it out!" "The last humans that went into the slime dungeon, never came back!" "I've heard that as much as a creator the Primordial is, he is also an agent of chaos!"  Legacy Quests [ ]  Prior to February 26, 2021 , Ivon offered legacy quests . The next quest would only be given after a player finished their current assigned quest. Completing a quest created a stronger bond with Ivon. With each Adventurer level gained, Ivon would randomly award blocks, seeds, or a furniture blueprint .  Quest Hit 100 star strikes on enemies . Defeat 10 enemies . Defeat 1 pink or blue slime . Sell 10 slimeballs taken off of slimes . Defeat 25 enemies . Defeat 5 pink or blue slimes . Sell 30 slimeballs taken off of slimes . Defeat 10 buffalkor . Defeat 100 enemies . Defeat 20 pink or blue slimes . Sell 100 slimeballs taken off of slimes . Defeat 25 buffalkor .  History [ ]  April 10, 2020 Added the Adventurer. May 4, 2020 The Adventurer now buys slime balls . May 26, 2020 Changed the Adventurer's appearance. July 11, 2020 Slime island keys are no longer sold by the Adventurer. August 9, 2020 The Adventurer now buys skorp scales. February 26, 2021 The Adventurer has been renamed to "Ivon". Ivon no longer offers quests . Ivon now has dialogue rather than opening the shop instantly. September 5, 2021 Ivon is given new dialogue about the "mystery". October 18, 2021 Changed Ivon's appearance. Removed Ivon's dialogue about the "mystery". July 2, 2022 Added new dialogue. October 22, 2022 Ivon now sells arrows .

title: January_15_2022
content: January 15, 2022 Basic Information Day released January 15, 2022 Version number 68 Version Navigator Previous version Next version January 8, 2022 January 30, 2022 The January 15, 2022 update, also known as the art museum update, is an update in Islands that introduced the Art Museum , various sculptures, and various price adjustments.  Changes [ ]  Additions [ ]  Added Art Museum Added Quinn Added Fulco Lisa Painting Added Family Painting Added The Screaming Davey Painting Added Cow Statue Added Chicken Statue Added Slime Statue Added Philosopher Statue Added Strongman Statue Added Thinker Statue  Modifications [ ]  Increased the sell price of wheat from 7 coins to 9. Increased the sell price of starfruit from 45 coins to 60. Increased the sell prices of crates of starfruit and large crates of starfruit 5,400 coins and 15,187 coins to 7,200 coins and 20,250 coins respectively. Red berry , blueberry , and blackberry totems can no longer be purchased from Arius . Changed the recipe of dragon rolls to require 2 cut eels instead of 1. Changed the recipe of tuna rolls to require 3 cut tuna instead of 1. Increased the reward luck granted from eating dragon rolls to +30%. Increased the sell multiplier bonus granted from eating tuna rolls to +7%. Player coin counts are now formatted with commas. The Hub is now larger to fit the Art Museum .  Other [ ]  Removed Christmas 2021 modifications. Christmas Present 2021s no longer spawn on player islands . Presents that haven't been mined remain.  Modifications (January 18, 2022) [ ]  Added icons to top 3 positions on the leaderboard.  Bug fixes (January 18, 2022) [ ]  Fixed bug whereby frost weapons caused people to lag or crash when placed in tool stands . Fixed Radish Cletus shop. title: January_20_2023
content: January 20, 2023 Basic Information Day released January 20, 2023 Version number 114 Version Navigator Previous version Next version January 6, 2023 February 3, 2023 The January 20, 2023 update, also known as the Lunar New Year 2023 update, is an update in Islands that initiated the Lunar New Year Event , introduced achievements , a new type of wood , and various new lunar new year-themed furniture blocks .  Content [ ]  Additions [ ]  Added achievements . Added gold envelope 2023s . Added red envelope 2023s . Added Lunar Rabbit . Added Lunar mooncakes . Added cherry blossom wood . Added cherry blossom stairs . Added cherry blossom slabs . Added cherry blossom signs . Added cherry blossom fences . Added trap door cherry blossoms . Added cherry blossom pallets . Fixed a bug causing cherry blossom blocks to replace tomato sauces when switching servers.  January 25, 2023 [ ]  Modifications [ ]  Removed collisions from cherry blossom saplings . Fixed a bug causing players falling into the Kor void would not kill them. Fixed a bug where shift-clicking coal would add multiple slots on the screen.  January 31, 2023 [ ]  Bug fixes [ ]  Fixed a bug causing Don and Hannah unable to teleport players back to the Hub. Fixed a bug prevented players from getting treasure maps from Davey. title: January_22_2021
content: January 22, 2021 Basic Information Day released January 22nd, 2021 Version number 31 Version Navigator Previous version Next version January 4, 2021 January 29, 2021  The January 22 2021 update, more commonly known as the XP + Animals update, featured an economy wipe, added a new animal, and introduced a skill level system.  Changes [ ]  Additions [ ]  Economy wipe [ ]  Removed Items based on a specific limit with an Economy Wipe . Players who accumulated over 100 million coins pre-wipe got rewarded with a golden portal color.  Skill levels [ ]  Added skill levels which are required for certain actions such as crafting, buying and selling items to villagers, fishing luck, etc. Skills are required in various ways related to their title. Farming Woodcutting Mining Economy Combat Light Melee Heavy Melee Archery Magic Cooking Animal Care Fishing Forging  Animal expansion [ ]  Added Sheep . Added animal spawn eggs which can be purchased from Taliyah . Cow Spawn Egg Sheep Spawn Egg Added animal breeding. Added baby animals. Animals now have unique personalities and traits. Players can now sell animals for coins and XP based on the animal's traits, personality, happiness and age. New happiness algorithm for animals. Animals now wag their tails, blink, and can look at the player. Animals are now able to eat grass blocks if no troughs are nearby. Added Shears . Added Cloth . Added Industrial Milker . Added Wool Vacuum .  Other [ ]  Added blocks of Wool that can be colored. Added Scratching Post . Added Spinach crop that can be fed to animals up to fifty times. New sidebar. Disabled "M" camera mode. Added Resistance Potion . Added Potion of Fertility . UI that tells the player when their friends join the game.  Modifications [ ]  Pink slime spawn chance increased to 5%. Island keys are replaced with the combat skill level and are no longer obtainable. Removed the Banker villager. Removed Taliyah's leveling system Removed Coin Bags . Redesigned the animal inspection menu on the Animal Well-being Kit . Improved block break particles. Changed the sapling growth speed to make it harder to afk macro. Increased tree health to make axes and woodcutting stats more useful. Updated the cow 's model and animations. Renamed wheat troughs into wooden troughs .  Fixes [ ]  Fixed all known dupes. Fixed crops instantly growing after rejoining the game.  Previous changes [ ]  January 11, 2021 [ ]  Removed portal to PvP Island . The Cutlass sword can no longer be purchased and is only obtainable through trading with other players. title: January_4_2021
content: January 4, 2021 Basic Information Day released January 4, 2021 Version number 30 Version Navigator Previous version Next version December 18, 2020 January 22, 2021 The January 4, 2021 update, also known as the Furniture update, is an update that introduced a wide variety of new furniture blocks.  Changes [ ]  Additions [ ]  PvP Island [ ]  Re-enabled PvP Island for around a week. Fighting will prevent the player from entering the safezone for 10 seconds. Mercenary offers the Cutlass as a new shop item for 100 skulls. Food has reduced healing on the PvP Island.  Crafting [ ]  Added 35+ new furniture items to the furniture workbench . Added categories to the tiered workbenches .  Other [ ]  Notification alerts when a friend joins the game. The game will attempt to place the player with their friends in the same chat room.  Modifications [ ]  Removed winter decorations from the Hub . Snow exists in limited quantites in the mountains. Ice is made unobtainable. Moved Electrite rocks to the Buffalkor Island . Removed the snowball machine gamepass from the store. Improved particles on a few blocks. Tweaked brightness on all light blocks. Reduced memory usage to make the game smoother for mobile players on large islands. Changed font in the obby timer. Renamed Carpentry Bench to Furniture Workbench . Changed compost working sprite texure. Removed everything but the terrain on Turkey Island .  Previous changes [ ]  These are changes that were made before January 4, 2021.  December 22, 2020 [ ]  Holding Q is now required to drop tools to avoid accidentally dropping them.  December 30, 2020 [ ]  Fixed dropped items despawning. Patched a dupe . Weapons no longer defaults to the new camera mode; pressing M is required to manually enable it. title: Jar_of_Honey
content: Jar of Honey Recipe 1 Honeycomb Crafted with Honey Press Heals 12 HP Sell price 20 coins Description Fresh honey from a local bee hive. A jar of honey is an item made by processing honeycomb .  Obtaining [ ]  Transforming [ ]  Honeycombs can be processed into jars of honey in a honey press . It takes about three and a half minutes to process one honeycomb into a jar of honey.
